name: #FREEDOM Craft Brewery
description:
#FREEDOM started as a joint venture of Barry Hansen Jr, Greg Cristallo, Angus Sinclair, David Hitchings, Eric Phillips and Harris Decker. The company now consists of eight partners and has recently moved into a new facility to begin production.

Established in 2012, #FREEDOM Craft Brewery (pronounced "Hashtag Freedom") features modern beers brewed using traditional methods. Our brews are all natural and our flagship beer is created entirely of American grown ingredients.

name: 1188 Brewing Company
description: Grant County's first brewery, we are nestled in the city of John Day, Oregon surrounded by beautiful mountains, rivers, and ranchlands. Stop by for a cold pint, or to fill a growler or two. In addition to our own beers brewed on site, we also offer a number of guest taps from small breweries around Oregon.

name: 1974 Brewing Company
description: 1974 Brewing Company is a nano brewery in planning, founded in 2012. We began brewing in late 2008 on a hobby scale with all grain 5 gallon batches. In late 2011 we moved up to 10 gallon batches. Brewing is not only a hobby but a way of life for us, once we started we just couldn’t seem to stop. We really enjoy the process of making the beer as well the finished product. Some of the success we have had in home brewing competitions has only given us confidence and motivation to take our hobby further. We plan on expanding our system to produce 7-10 barrels per batch in 2012 as well as filing the necessary paperwork to begin a legitimate brewery, distributing our beers to the public.

name: 2 Witches Winery and Brewing Company, Inc.
description: 2 Witches Winery & Brewing Company, located in Danville, Virginia, is a combination farm/urban winery and picobrewery. We are affiliated with 2 Witches Vineyard located in Chatham, Virginia. We hope to open in May 2013.

name: 3 Guys and a Beer'd Brewing Company
description: We strive to make a quality, flavorful brew that all tastebuds will enjoy!

name: 3 Sheeps Brewing Co
description:
All families have their stories: tales of grandparents and great-grandparents and the incredible things they accomplished, or lived through, or overcame. My family was no different. I grew up hearing stories that cascaded across a broad plain of topics, but the ones that fascinated me most centered around the Kingsbury Breweries.

Back in 1926, the Kingsbury Breweries, then known as the Gutsch Brewery, declared bankruptcy. It was a tough time for breweries across the country as Prohibition was in full effect. Many breweries failed during that time, and the Gutsch Brewery was on its way to joining them. It was at this time that my family took the helm of the brewery. Soon after, they changed the name to the Kingsbury Breweries, expanded coast-to-coast, and turned the brewery into what we remember it as today.

I grew up hearing stories from my father, who, as a child with his father, would go around the various Kingsbury Breweries, see the brewers hard at work, and watch the customers enjoy a beer in the Ratskellar. This is where my interest was first piqued by the great world of beer. Many years later, thanks to a brilliant gift on my wife’s part, I started making my own beer. From that point forward there was no turning back. The hobby turned into a passion, which turned into an obsession, which turned into quitting my day job and opening a brewery.

This is my Really Cool Waterslide - my choice to take a dream and make it my reality. Thank you to all those who have helped me get here.

- Grant Pauly, 3 Sheeps Brewing

name: 38 State Brewing Company
description:
We started out years ago brewing in our garage. Friends and family would always come by to hang out, drink our beer, socialize and watch whatever game was on. Soon our garage was filled with so many people we decided to find a bigger one and open it up to everyone! We took a chance and opened a nano-brewery and tasting room. Now we can offer our beer to current and future friends in our community! Visit our website for our beer menu, more info and updates. www.38statebrew.com

We're located in Littleton, Colorado. So whether you're a local or just passing through, please stop by, take a load off and sample some of our tasty brews. Trust us... you will not be disappointed! Cheers!!

name: 3rd Wave Brewing Co.
description: 3rd Wave Brewing Co. is a dream between to friends who love the beach and love to brew beer. We hope you visit us often and enjoy Good Friends, Good Waves, Great Beer!

name: 4 Brothers Blended Beer
description:
4 Brothers Custom Blended Craft Beer evolved from a combination of passion, innovation, experimentation, configuration and fermentation; followed by extensive libation and imbibition. Yep, brewing blended beer is damn hard work. Especially the tasting part. Cheers for Libations!

Until we 4 Brothers started the process of evolving our avocation into our vocation, there really hasn't been a true innovation in the beer industry in years. Maybe since the monks first put their quills to parchment and recorded their initial beer recipes.

IPAs, Porters, Pilsners, Lagers, Browns, Reds, Blondes. All magnificent purebreds. 4 Brothers is the World Class Custom Blended Craft Beer, combining the best qualities of each.

Our signature beer, Sibling Rivalry, combines the taste profiles of a darker beer, a lighter beer and a hoppier beer to produce an incredibly drinkable and delicious beer.

4 Brothers custom blended craft beers are perfect for enthusiasts, fun-lovers and those who don't take themselves too seriously. Yep; drinkability, flavor and authenticity. And we think that is something to shout about, despite the monk's vow of silence.

name: 40 Arpent Brewing Company
description: Forty Arpent is a Louisiana Brewery using traditonal brewing techniques, with local ingredients, to make new flavor profiles uniqe to the Gulf Coast. Our take on an Irish Red Ale (Creole Red Bean And Rice Ale) will truly make Monday's Special something to look forward to.

name: 5 Stones Artisan Brewery
description: We are a small batch nano-brewery located "down around" San Antone. Our primary focus is limited releases each season brewed with the freshest local ingredients we can get our hands on.

name: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro
description: 57 Brew Pub & Bistro is located in Greenville Michigan. We are excited to bring this new establishment to our community. We feature our own locally brewed beers on site, and our Bistro features a full menu of American Cuisine from appetizers, soups & salads, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrees & Desserts. We opened in late October 2012! Stop in and see us soon

name: 603 Brewery
description: 603 Brewery was founded in 2012 by long time college friends.  As home brewers, who met while studying engineering, they set out to design high quality, hand crafted beers.  As demand for the beers increased, the vision to launch a microbrewery was developed.  With a focus on quality and versatility, our hand crafted beer is brewed using the finest ingredients in small batches.

name: 7 Devils Brewing Co
description: The 7 Devils Brewing Company is a small craft brewery on a mission to bring the inspiration of our coastal area to the tap. Walking through our doors should create the same restorative feelings of walking toward the shore. We wish to be a sustainable business that is socially, ethically and environmentally responsible and provides a place where passionate people converge to create a positive environment and inspired products. Our goal is to enhance the community in which we live and succeed financially so that we can provide family wage jobs for creative people in a progressive workplace. With core values of efficiency, ingenuity, pride in craftsmanship, environmental and social responsibility and superior customer service, the 7 Devils Brewing Company is crafting the change we wish to see in the world.

name: 7venth Sun Brewing
description: Belgian-style beer, IPAs, second use spirit barrel aged beer, oak aged sour beer.

name: Abandon Brewing
description: Overlooking beautiful Keuka Lake, we brew many different Belgian and Farmstyle craft beers for the Penn Yan and surrounding Finger Lakes areas.

name: Abigaile Brewery
description: Abigaile is an effort by Hermosa Beach local Jed Sanford to bring a distinctive take on the American brasserie experience to Hermosa Beach; all in a communal setting that celebrates the location’s rich history as a gathering place for locals from all walks of life.

name: Adventure Brewery
description:
We started officially brewing in January 2012, though we brewed for ourselves long before that. With so much great feedback we concluded it would be a crime not to share our passion for beer with everyone. We've been heavily influenced by so many beers particularly by breweries from the 1800's that have now long-since closed their doors. Heritage is important to us and all our beers are made with a definitive nod to the brewers and breweries of former times. If we can develop great beer and give people a history lesson at the same time we would be two very happy brewers!

We regularly produce a range of four core beers (North, South, West and East) and North Pole is brewed for the festive season. We also brew a new limited edition beer each month, produced in small batches and aimed the drinker wanting something just a little bit different. You can find reviews of our core range here, and the first of our limited edition beers here.

So, join us on our Adventure! Be it bottle or cask...

name: Aftershock Brewing Company
description:
After 27 years of steady brewing, we thought it would be fun to share the results of the brewing experience with others.  We are a small brewery, and are truly “hands on” every step of the brewing process.  Our goal is to produce the best, most flavorful, most memorable local beers possible.  We think we’ve met that goal, & hope you’ll agree.

At Aftershock, we believe there are two different approaches to brewing.  The most common approach used by the major breweries is a ‘scientific one’.  All stages of the brewing process are closely monitored to ensure a consistent, if tasteless product.  Computers and other high tech equipment are more in control than the brewer himself.  With this approach you get ‘scientific’ beer.  The other approach is a more artistic one, while still respecting basic laws of science, and the need for spotless cleanliness.  That’s the approach we plan to always take at Aftershock.  At the risk of losing an undetectable amount of consistency, the result is beer with much more character, subtle nuances, and awesome flavor.  Don’t take our word for it; check us out.

name: Against The Grain Brewery
description:
Louisville's only brewer-owned brewery is, like most worthwhile undertakings, the product of dissatisfaction with the status quo. The Louisville area has had a number of quality brewpubs for some time now, but still there was simply not enough beer! Against the Grain is an effort to help solve this problem. We maintain a diverse array of beers covering all of the major categories of beer flavor while generating an endless stream of innovative new brews. In short, everything is "specialty" Boredom will be extremely difficult.

Our food is designed with same philosophy as our brewing. Fresh and interesting smokehouse fare with a gastropub flare lets us bring you the very best flavors to stand alone and to compliment our beers. Regular menu changes allow us to take full advantage of the best seasonal ingredients, our chef's whim, and optimal pairing with our dynamic beer list.

Throw your preconceived notions right the hell out the window. We aren't just another brewpub. We are Against the Grain!

name: Ale Syndicate
description: Ale Syndicate Brewers is one of Chicago's newest breweries. Located in the Logan Square community, Ale Syndicate is dedicated to making craft beer worthy of Chicagoans. Ale Syndicate's founders, brothers Samuel Evans and Jesse Edwin Evans, aim to produce their unique take on traditional styles of beer, such as IPA, porter and session ale. Learn more at alesyndicate.com

name: Aloha Beer Company
description:
Aloha Beer Company embodies the classic Hawaii lifestyle. With the generous spirit of Aloha as a namesake, this is a premium beer that combines the smooth balance of ohana with the refreshing, hang-loose attitude of a Sunday barbecue. Every bottle of "Hawaii's Beer" is a heartfelt "wish you were here" message from the Islands of Aloha.

We can't create a Hawaiian sunrise, but we can brew the next best thing.

name: Alphabet City Brewing Company
description: Established in 2012 and proud to be one of the few New York City breweries. NYC has had a rich brewing history that reaches back over 100 years. This has given ACBC a strong foundation on which to build and offers a challenge we enthusiastically embrace everyday. We started as two roommates in the Alphabet City neighborhood of the East Village of NYC brewing beer in our kitchen and are excited to be on the verge of opening a brew pub there in the near future. We love beer and love sharing our beers with friends and that's what our style of brewing is all about. It's about camaraderie and the group experience. We provide brews for the table that everyone can gather around; brews perfect for the meal you're about to have or the story about to be shared - brews for celebrations and brews for collaboration - we brew for you.

name: American Dream Brewing
description:
American Dream Brewing is a craft brewery coming to Simi Valley soon, offering quality, handcrafted, fresh, brewed beers for both wholesale and retail distribution.  We will have an on-premise tasting room to experience the full flavor taste of our craft brewed beers. We create both traditional beer styles as well as new styles with unique twists.  

American Dream Brewing Company understands the passion that surrounds beer.  We pour that passion into every drop of our beer.  It’s that love to enjoy the best tasting beer that we use the highest quality ingredients.  

We look forward to inviting you to enjoy the American Dream by drinking our beers and celebrating life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness!

name: Amplified Ale Works
description:
Alex Pierson and JC Hill got their noses in the restaurant business in 2009, opening the first California Kebab at San Diego State University. After a few years, it was clear they needed to spread the kebab love elsewhere, and decided on a run down old resturant site with an ocean view..

Craft beer has been a part of the concept since day 1, and JC's severe homebrewing addiction ignited the need for their own brewing system at the new establishment - Amplified Ale Works was born. Why Amplified you ask? Two parts – one, our obsession with live music (a band was formed between CK staff in 2009, playing in JC’s garage ever since), and two, our take on the meaning of Amplified- to us, it means intensifying the craft beer experience by staying true to our homebrewing roots. We hope to see you soon at CK Brewpub enjoying a fresh ale on our biergarten patio at the beach. Prost!

name: Antietam Brewery
description:
Our journey began with the opening of Benny's Pub 5 years ago. We have become known for our excellence in customer service and our strong passion for creating the best experiences and memories for our patrons. We are an American version of the throw-back 'Public Houses' that were the forefathers of today's 'Pubs'. We create delicious soups from scratch, unique sandwiches and dinner entrees using the best local ingredients.

Crafting delicious beer was the next natural step for Benny's Pub. Our loyal customers are passionate about the food and beer they drink- and we promise to deliver. Consumers want healthy, organic produce and food- and they want it to be local. Our menu highlights local meats, fresh cheeses and now hand-crafted beer brewed right in front of you.

name: Apocalypse Ale Works
description: Apocalypse Ale Works is the first brewery in Forest, Virginia since Thomas Jefferson brewed in the 1800's at Poplar Forest. In addition to a brewery, we also have a tasting room, where the public can try our products. We are located in the old Forest Volunteer Fire Department, beside Pints O'Plenty. The brewery will sell kegs all over the state of Virginia, with an emphasis on supplying the local restaurants first. Eventually we will expand to bottling our beer. Our mission is to brew quality beer for all palates. The end of bad beer is here!

Drink well and do good work!

name: Argilla Brewing Co. @ Pietro's Pizza
description:
We first opened our doors in Prices Corner in 1978, later settling in Pike Creek for over 20 years. After Homebrewing for several years, we've decided to expand to our new location (2667 Kirkwood Highway - Newark, DE) and install a 1.5 barrel brewery, making us the smallest brewery in the state of Delaware. We brew beers to please all kinds, including an Amber Ale, Rye Stout and an IPA that recently won a ribbon at the Delaware State Fair Battle of the Brews.

Since we're so small, we'll be sure to experiment with several different styles of beer, so there will always be something new to check out.  Along with the beer, we'll have the same great pizzas we've been serving up for over 33 years. We'll also have soups, salads, pub sandwiches and select entrees. Also be on the lookout for our occasional beer dinners and pizza beer dinners.   We're just as passionate about our food as we are about our beer.

name: Aslan Brewing Company
description: Aslan Brewing Company is a local microbrewery committed to pushing the boundaries of craft beer while preserving the purity of brewing tradition. We only use the finest certified organic ingredients the Pacific Northwest has to offer, creating some of the cleanest and most unique brews in the market today. Truly dank brew; Pride of the Organic Northwest.

name: Atlas Brew Works
description: A packaging craft brewery in the District of Columbia. Atlas Brew Works focuses on providing D.C. with fresh, craft ales and lagers.

name: Avenues Proper Restaurant and Publick House
description: New Restaurant & Small Batch Brewery In The Avenues of Salt Lake City, Utah.

name: Back Alley Brewery
description: Back Alley Brewery was established in 2012 as a privately owned brewery and sports bar. It offers several hand crafted beers and ales. Come join us for great brew and watch your favorite sporting events.

name: Back East Brewing Company
description:
Back East was formed by Edward Fabrycki, Jr. and Tony Karlowicz, two cousins with a passion for great-tasting, high-quality beer. Back East brews several different styles of high-quality ales and lagers and distributed on draft and in 64 oz growlers and 750 ml bottles at fine establishments throughout the Greater Hartford area. 

Although originally from Connecticut, Edward began to home-brew while living in San Diego in the early 1990s. He eventually moved Back East to Connecticut in 2000, with the dream of someday operating a Craft brewery. As a Professional Engineer, Edward enjoys the technical aspects of brewing. Tony developed his appreciation for Craft beer during his college years in Vermont, and always imagined launching a brewery. An entrepreneur at heart and a CPA with extensive experience in accounting, auditing, and insurance, Tony loves building a successful business from the ground up. Tony and Edward began homebrewing and experimenting with different recipes in early 2006, and immersed themselves in all things Craft beer. 

Over this time, we have developed several exciting recipes that we are proud to put the Back East name on. Our beer will be brewed at our small, but state-of-the-art brewery in Bloomfield.

name: Backpocket Brewing
description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.

name: Backshore Brewing Company
description: There's something about the beach that feeds your soul, keeps you young, and demands your return. Of the millions who visit, a few are distracted by romantic visions of life at the beach and are left behind, never to return to the "real world." It's an existence unaffected by time or authority. Days and nights blend together, signaled by sunrises over the ocean and sunsets in the bay. Their hearts become gorged with rebellion and pride, inherent in all Americans but enjoyed by few. It is with the same celebration of freedom and togetherness that we have conceived this beer. We brew our beer in the salty air with our toes in the sand and the sun on our faces. Lucky for you, we can't finish it all. Please have as much fun drinking Backshore Beer as we have making it. We've spent serious time creating it. Have a ridiculous time enjoying it.

name: Backwoods Brewing Company
description:
We are a locally owned, and locally brewing in the Backwoods.

We are a 10 BBL Brewery in our first year of operation. The Brewery is nestled in the Heart of the Gorge. The Waters Family operates the brewpub and loves to serve our customers. We cannot wait to serve you and show you what our beer and the Gorge has to offer!

name: BAD Brewing Co
description: BAD Brewing Company is a small Microbrewery locatedin downtown Mason, MI that opened in the Summer of 2012. We will offer a wide selection of hand crafted beers. We will have at least five house beers on tap, with several more on a rotating basis. All of the beers are hand crafted on site by the owner, and new recipes are always in the works! BAD Brewing looks forward to serving Mason and the Greater Lansing area the finest hand crafted beers possible. Have a BAD day!

name: Bad Weather Brewing Company
description: Bad Weather Brewing Company knows the beer-lover's calendar is one that changes with seasons. BWBC offers unique beers with Midwestern Edge to them. These beers complement and celebrate the shifting summer sun and frigid winter winds.

name: Badger Hill Brewing
description:
A family united by a hankering for travel and craft beer. In our blood: A melting pot of European heritage. Our passion: The singular love of beer. Our mission: Sharing what topped our taste-o-meters. We do hope you like them—and our promise is that we’ll keep coming up with new recipes while staying true to the brew. Mostly.

Wondering about our name? Badger Hill is a rough translation of the two brothers’ names in Old English and speaks to the influence of their European heritage. Plus, they liked how it sounded.

name: BadWolf Brewing Company
description:
BadWolf Brewing Company is a family-owned and operated nanobrewery in Manassas, VA founded on June 28, 2012. The Co-Founders, Jeremy and Sarah Meyers, are local residents who grew up in the NOVA area and have always dreamed of having a brewery. Jeremy has been brewing beer over 10 years inspired by his trip to Germany. Sarah has a background in business so it's a perfect match. The couple is passionate about craft beer and believes in sharing it with YOU! 

The brewing setup is a 1 barrel brewing system so BadWolf can pump out a variety of beers in the taproom. Free popcorn will be offered to cleanse the palate! We don't serve food but you can bring your own or order delivery. BadWolf will offer pints and samples on site and offer growlers to go.

name: Baeltane Brewing
description:
Baeltane Brewing is a small production brewery and tasting room located in Novato, CA (Marin County).

Our Marin brewery proudly produces artisanal ales for the discerning consumer. The beers we produce feature the artistry of our Head Brewer, Alan Atha, specializing in Belgian, French and West Coast Ale styles.

We might be small but our impression is huge.

name: Bainbridge Island Brewing Company
description:
Making a great beer requires a combination of art and science.  Science, in knowing what the gear and the ingredients can do.  Art, in imagining what beer can be.  Whether it's excellent versions of classic styles, or boundary pushing experimental brews, we strive to blend the art and science of beer.

But beer is also a social beverage.  The pub is part of our culture, and here in the Northwest that means locally brewed craft beer.  The local brewery is part of the fabric of the community, giving it character, individuality, and indeed, an air of hometown pride.  Bainbridge Island is certainly a great place to live, but it's been lacking one thing: our own craft microbrewery.  Well, no longer!  Bainbridge Island Brewing is the island's brewery, and the island is as much a part of us as we are of it.

name: BearWaters Brewing Company
description: BearWaters Brewing Company is located in Waynesville North Carolina in the beautiful Smoky Mountains of Western North Carolina. Come enjoy what happens when fearless creativity, maticulous brewing meets natures greatest natural resource.

name: Begyle Brewing
description:
Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.

Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

description: Micro Brewery in Vista, CA - North San Diego County

name: Bellwoods Brewery
description:
Bellwoods Brewery is a new Toronto microbrewery, retail store & café coming to Ossington and Argyle early in 2012

We intend to produce a diverse range of craft ales and fermented elixirs for both wholesale and retail customers.

Bellwoods Brewery will also operate a small indoor picnic-style cafe in collaboration with local chefs for lovers of craft beer.

name: Below the Radar Brewing Company
description:
Below the Radar is Huntsville’s first Micro-Brewhouse situated in the Historic Huntsville Times Building in the recently stablished “downtown entertainment district”. Below the Radar opened its doors on August 2012 and has been expanding its lunch and dinner menu of goodness as well as its micro-brews & drinks ever since.Below the Radar is a great place to have lunch or meet after work for socializing with friends and co-workers. BTR is known for its one of a kind variety of micro-brews, extensive wine list and liquor drinks or its wonder array of food by its own in-house Chef Bill Harden. BTR menu items include like roast beef sliders topped with cilantro-horseradish sauce. And how about some Lazy Magnolia Southern Pecan Ice Cream for dessert!
Enjoy live music every Tesday night to make it a night to remember.

BTR is open 7 days a week for lunch & dinner (including a very special “Chef Bill Brunch” on Sundays). Be sure to check out the Chef Dish Pick of the Week.

BTR has thirty-two beers on tap including 7 craft brews made in-house, more than 27 bottled beers.

BTR has a Full bar and a great selection of fine wines. Be sure to check our Wine Pick of the Week.

An upscale, yet relaxed, and nonsmoking atmosphere.

name: Bemidji Brewing Company
description: Bemidji Brewing Company LLC is a small craft brewery based out of the beautiful city of Bemidji, MN. Craft beer is our passion, and we hope to provide the freshest, most high quality craft beer to Bemidji and the northwoods.

name: Benchmark Brewing Company
description: Benchmark Brewing is all about delicious beer, beer that we want to take home and drink. We want consistently awesome beer that you can rely on to be the gold standard of the style.  Our year round beers are low in alcohol and high in flavor; we often find that it is nice to be able to enjoy a beer or two and keep your wits about you.  We also know that there are times when a ten percent beer is just what you need to keep you warm at night; to that end we will celebrate the seasons, months, weeks, or whatever we feel needs celebration with specialty releases that will vary wildly in alcohol content and style.  No matter the style or strength all Benchmark Beer will set the standard for its kind.

name: Bevog
description:
Bevog microbrewery is the fruit of inquisitiveness and aspiration towards discovering new beer-drinking experiences; it is the result of enthusiasm, love and zeal. We brew beers with character and soul. Our goal is to transcend the limits of the known and ordinary.

We have had enough of a monotonous beer offer and the belittling of beer. Beer can be and is much more than that. Bevog brewery is dedicated primarily to beers of top fermentation, more commonly known as ales. The ales we brew basically originate from England. In the last few decades this highly diverse type of beer has been given greater breadth, a wider range of flavors, has been shifting the boundaries of individual styles and becoming more and more popular around the world. It is gaining popularity not only with beer lovers and beer drinkers, but in general with gourmets, top chefs and people who are always willing to explore new flavors and experiences and who care about what they ingest.

name: Beyond The Pale Brewing Company
description:
Beyond the Pale was started as a small neighbourhood brewery by three local guys who grew up, went to school, and currently reside in the neighbourhood. Equipped with an old 400L brew system and a belief that there was room in the market for somebody wanting to make a variety of full flavour, unique beers, we embarked on our journey in early 2012. The concept was simple: make a variety of beers that WE wanted to drink and create a tasting opportunity for our customers to come into the brewery to decide what they liked, and buy to go.

During our first year of operation we released over 20 different beers, underwent one expansion, and our MO remains the same as it was in the beginning. In addition to the retail store our beers can also be found in over 30 local bars and restaurants.

You can be sure when you pick up a glass or bottle of our beer that you’re drinking a fresh local product. We work that little old brew house like a pack mule to crank out as much beer as possible. Nearly all of our beer is sold to customers within a week of leaving our brite tanks. That’s freshness that’s hard to find elsewhere.

name: Big Alice Brewing Company
description: In late 2012, Big Alice will arrive in Long Island City as one of its first breweries since Prohibition offering small batch, handcrafted, high quality beers to the neighborhood utilizing local and organic ingredients whenever possible. We look forward to turning pounds of grain into gallons of beer.

name: Big Bend Brewing Company
description:
To give West Texas a brand of beer that embodies the qualities of liberty and persistence that make the people of Big Bend exceptional.

A Microbrewery Coming to Alpine Texas with Head Brewer Steve Anderson from Live Oak in Austin

name: Big Choice Brewing
description: Big Choice Brewing is a microbrewery owned by Nathaniel Miller, his wife Andrea and Tyler Ruse, all Colorado natives that want to make great beer for their local communities. Come by the tasting room and see what the Big Choice is all about.

description: Big Elm Brewing is a production brewery in Sheffield, MA. Bill and Christine Heaton, former owners/brewers for Pittsfield Brew Works are canning and kegging their beers which are available all over Berkshire County.

name: Big Head Brewing Company
description: We are a local craft brewery crafting the finest craft beers. Our brewery is in start up mode. We will be on tap in local establishments around Milwaukee in early 2013.

name: Big Rig Brewery
description:
Our beers are hand crafted in small batches using the finest ingredients, traditional brewing methods and passion to bring you the best possible beer we can…

Beer is like food… the better the ingredients the better the beer. We take pride in sourcing the best possible ingredients from around the world and from our own back yard. Malts from Canada, England and Germany have been hand pick to produce a strong base in our brews. Hops, like grapes, are influenced by the territory, so if a beer style calls for hops from Germany we get hops from Germany. We love our ingredients so much we are planting our very own Hop yard at the Phillips Farm in Manotick, there we will grow specialty hops exclusively for our local brews. Our heritage yeast is housed in a special yeast laboratory to ensure the consistency and freshness of our brews. Our water is double filtered and boiled to give us a “clean slate”, and to finish it off we adjust the natural flavor compounds in the water to suit our various beer styles.

Good ingredients are the start of a great brew…

We use time honored and perfected brewing traditions that have been passed down from brewmaster to brewmaster for centuries. These methods are steeped in artisan spirit and have the precision of science. Using these methods, with our state of the art brewing system allows us to produce hand crafted beers that are pure, free of added chemicals and preservatives, full of flavor and rich in character. 
Generations of brewers have combined their knowledge to bring you this pint
Passion for the craft of beer is in every batch we make. Our brewmaster makes beer because he loves beer. The satisfaction of a job well done is confirmed with the good times, new friendships and community that is formed around sharing a great pint.

For the Love of Beer

name: Birbeck's Brewing Company
description:
Birbeck's Brewing Company will redefine Australian beer by offering full flavoured craft beers moving Australian beer away from the ordinary to the extraordinary.

Birbeck's beers are well crafted beers designed for the Australian climate and palate. By taking traditional beer styles and an innovative approach, Birbeck’s Brewing beers will offer high quality approachable beers for all occasions.

The name Birbeck originates from a hamlet in North West England and in old Norse means birch wood by the stream. Drawing on this family history Birbeck's beers will focus on innovative new styles of beers perfect for the Australian climate as well as some traditional English styles. Approachable, easy drinking and hoppy.

The first beer released by Birbeck's Brewing is Four Brothers, a well balanced and hoppy Australian interpretation of the IPA style.

The second beer to be released by Birbeck's Brewing is The Captain, a refreshing beer full of complex malt flavours and strong hop presence. An Australian Mild Ale, The Captain is a beer for any occasion.

name: Blacklist Brewing
description:
Break the Big Beer Model! Beer brewed with quality, creativity and culture in mind. See our 2013 beer offerings, to the right, and look for our upcoming Kickstarter Campaign for details.

Blacklist is a year long project that meshes local artisans with beer and the brewing process to create fun and unique collaborations. Featuring a different artist and brew each month, we bring you a drinking experience worth sharing and talking about. Available in VERY limited quantities for pick-up in MN only. Look for further details on our upcoming kickstarter.com campaign. Til then, Skal, and stay thirsty for new beers.

name: Blind Squirrel
description: The Vance Toe River Lodge was originally built in 1919 as the T. B. Vance General Store. After trading hands through the years and seeing its fair share of abuse it was renovated by the Young family and continues to evolve.  With that evolution came the expansion of our  “Lodge Family”.  When Aaron Maas moved to Plumtree, NC in 2009 as an avid home brewer, the dream to open a brewery slowly moved towards reality.  After 3 painstaking years, the brewery finally opened in July of 2012.  We are excited to be able to live in such a wonderful place and still have the ability to follow our passions.  Come out to Plumtree so we can prove to you that we’re nuts about beer!!

A state-of-the-art brewing system consists of a 5 barrel Mash Tun, Brew Kettle and 10 barrel Fermenters & Brights . The brewery offers an impressive variety of craft beers brewed by master brewer, Ray Hodge. The Blowing Rock Ale House restaurant offers a freshly prepared, seasonally changing menu using local & organic ingredients when available. 64 ounce “growler” fills of freshly brewed beer are offered daily, with brewery tours 1:00-5:30pm Saturdays. We hope you will join us for lunch & dinner, 11am-9pm.

name: Blue Bali
description:
Originating from Lock Road at Gillman Village The Villa Bali has bought in its joglos, lesehans and other Balinese paraphernalia. Affectionately known as Little Bali, we left behind our iconic Majapahid Gate, a legacy of the tragic bombing of Bali on 12 October 2002. 
Our Mission – Providing a dining and entertainment experience that allows people to commune with nature, relax, de-stress and be happy. By bringing nature and the Bali culture of service into the living or dining space our guests can experience the ultimate environment to chill-out, dine and entertain their friends and family.

name: Blue Bee Cider
description:
Virginia’s first and only urban cidery, Blue Bee Cider is located in the heart of downtown Richmond’s Old Manchester district at the fall line of the James River. The name for Blue Bee Cider is derived from a common name for one of Virginia’s native bees, osmia lignaria, or the blue orchard bee. These hardworking bees are solitary and wild, emerging early in the cool spring just in time to pollinate apple blossoms.

At Blue Bee Cider, we aim to create balanced ciders true to their Virginia roots from a culinary perspective and true to the fruit from a cidermaking one. Each apple variety ferments differently, creating its own flavors which vary year to year depending on weather conditions. Blue Bee Ciders are never chapitalized (it’s so sunny in the South, who needs to add sugar?) and never watered down. We use raw juice and ferment it straight off the press.

name: Blue Lobster Brewing Company
description:
Blue Lobster Brewing Company will be coming to Hampton, New Hampshire in 2012! Featuring fine craft beers from Michael and Roberta Benoit, Blue Lobster will become a common sight in your favorite local restaurants and bars.

Michael and Roberta have been crafting beer for 30 years (okay, so Michael crafts it, but Roberta helps design and drink it). After many years of wandering the country in exotic places like Texas, California, and for the last 12 years Oregon, they are looking forward to bringing their unique, locally-inspired brews to New Hampshire. Blue Lobster will feature small batch specialty brews, as well as more traditional beers - all served in our own tasting room AT the brewery. 

Freshly brewed beers will be available for sale in our tasting room and retail shop in swingtop amber 750ml growlers. swingtop amber 2L growlers, and 1/6th keg sales. Specialty bottle releases available in corked 750ml champagne bottles.

name: Blue Spruce Brewing
description:
Brewer, Rick Kane has been brewing beer since the early 90's. After brewing so long he decided to go to school and get a degree in Beer Engineering, which fit perfectly with his science teaching credential. His plan is to have 8-12 beers on tap, along with a couple of local guest taps. 
The restaurant will feature taco shop mexican food. There will be appetizers that pair perfectly with beer, along with some sandwich and salad options. 
We know that Highlands Ranch and Centennial have been waiting for a local brewery to call their own. Hold on tight, here we come!

name: Boondocks Brewing Tap Room & Restaurant
description:
Great Beer - Great Food - Great Service - Great Friends - Great Value

Boondocks Brewing Tap Room & Restaurant's goal is to provide a fresh, unique and engaging destination that will not only attract new visitors to West Jefferson and Ashe County but will also be a place that residents are proud to call their own. 

We are Ashe County's first and only Commercially licensed Craft Beer Brewery and we brew small batches of hand crafted beers weekly that are only available in our Tap Room.

With two fully stocked bars we have over 30 craft beers on tap that are constantly rotating along with a large selection of bottled beers with a strong focus on North Carolina craft beers. You will be hard pressed to find a better craft beer selection.

We have an affordable menu featuring casual-upscale high-quality items using fresh and locally grown ingredients prepared by our talented Chef and kitchen team.

Come and see what all the excitement is about in wonderful West Jefferson.

Committed to Excellence- Dedicated to Community

name: Brasserie St. James
description: We make beers for all palates. A lot of our beers have been lovingly referred to as so finely crafted that they seem to be made for a serious wine drinkers palate. A saying goes in wine making, "it takes a lot of good beer to make good wine...". The point being, we make complex, delicate, nuanced beers, not just the same typical west coast hop bombs or dark extremely high alcohol brews (though we make quality versions of those too). Our goal is to show the whole spectrum of beer, its history, and its evolution. To show beer its proper reverence, as not only "The people's beverage", but one that pairs as well with food as wine, and when it's skillfully crafted and not over hopped to hide the flaws in production, it does. The truth is, it takes more skill to make a delicate lager, than a double IPA. You would be hard pressed to find anyone more passionate and knowledgeable about beer than myself or my brewer Josh Watterson. We welcome you to come down to our weekly brewery tours, and discuss all things beer, food, wine, or whatever be the topic of the day!

name: Brevard Brewing Co.
description:
The world of beer is increasingly one of two extremes.  While large macro-breweries compete to produce the lightest, most flavorless, adjunct laden beers possible, craft breweries strive to out-do one another by making each beer hoppier, bolder, and stronger than the next.  At Brevard Brewing Company, we have set out to give beer lovers the best of both worlds – beer that is both drinkable and flavorful.  We are the only brewery in Western North Carolina to specialize in lagers. 

What’s the big deal about lagers? Lagers are cold-fermented and aged over twice as long as ales.  They are more costly to produce, and take more patience to brew. Unlike the big flavors of ales that hide imperfections, lagers demand a higher standard of quality and care, making them a rare find in the craft beer world.  But the result is worth the attention to detail--this painstaking process creates a beer that is clean, smooth, and crisp as opposed to the bold, complex flavor of ales.  The imported German barley, hops, and yeast delivers delicate and refined beers that are delicious and flavorful, yet supremely drinkable.

While German-inspired lagers are my specialty, I will never forget the wonderful contributions that American home brewers have made to the beer world over the past thirty years.  I typically find myself drinking a cold, smooth, Pilsner, but every now and again, my taste buds crave a bold, hoppy American IPA.  This is why Brevard Brewing Company offers American ales in addition to German lagers.  No matter your mood or what you are craving, we have the right beer for you.

name: Brewery Ferment
description:
Ferment is an inviting, casual, neighborhood brewery that is truly all about the beer. We blend traditional styles and techniques with a new world approach to brewing, influenced by traditions throughout the world while remaining true to Northern Michigan.

We believe in emphasizing our Midwestern roots
This area has ample farmland, and hops grow perfectly here. We aim to make the most of what local growers have to offer, brewing with Northern Michigan ingredients as much as possible. We also have a small menu of unique bar snacks and outside food is welcome. We have five flagship beers on draft along with rotating specialties and bottled conditioned beers. Stop in, have a pint and you will notice the local difference.

name: Brewery Rickoli
description:
We are proud to announce the recent opening of Brewery Rickoli, The Premier Brewery in Wheat Ridge Colorado, serving freshly brewed craft beer and offering a relaxed and friendly space to gather. We are located by the Southwest corner of 44th Ave. and Wadsworth Blvd.

Our take on beer is simple – Use great ingredients and brew for flavor!  Rickoli’s respects the liquid in the glass and wants to help elevate beer to a refined drinking experience. That’s why we use the finest ingredients and brew in a leisurely manner. The beer tells us when it’s ready. We refuse to be a slave to production deadlines.  Wheat Ridge Colorado is a relaxed community just west of Denver with easy access from I-70. Wheat Ridge was one of the few remaining enclaves along the Front Range without a microbrewery. This changed in November 2012!  We are dedicated to providing our local neighborhood with a place to relax and have a pint close to home.

Our Brew master, Rick Abitbol has been professionally brewing award winning beers along the Front Range for over a decade.  Rick is respectful of beer styles and traditional brewing technique.  And has long been an innovator of style and not afraid to color outside the lines. He was one of the first brewers to explore the Black IPA which has since come to be regarded as a new style in judging guidelines.   We love hops! That’s not to say you won’t find any wonderfully malty creations on tap there are many, but what you will notice is the variety in our hoppy selections.  Be on the lookout for Rick’s special brews!

We’re Talking Much Better Beer!  We are pleased to feature a great selection of Gluten Reduced Beer.  All Rickoli’s brews that do not contain wheat are considered gluten reduced.  Making great craft beer more accessible to everyone.
  
Our glass rinsing stations insure a beer clean glass every time! We want you to drink beer not sanitizer! We hope you will stop by for a pint or two!

We specialize in the production of inspired, rustic ales on our 5 bbl brewhouse utilizing a unique strain of saison yeast and relying on nature and the elements. We have no control over fermentation temperature so we brew seasonally, in a more natural setting, creating interesting challenges and ultimately more unique ales of distinction. We also implement the use of barrel-aging, a time honored technique that encourages the growth of wild yeast and bacteria, creating even more character and nuance.

name: Community Beer Company
description:
BEER FOR THE GREATER GOOD.....

Community Beer Company represents many meanings --
all centered on what we feel a great Community represents.

FIRST: Beer is Communal. For ages, it’s been a central part of get-togethers among friends, family, and co-workers to celebrate old acquaintances ... or make new ones. 

SECOND: As a brewery, we are passionate about providing quality craft beer to the people within our Community: Dallas, Texas and the surrounding Metroplex. 

THIRD: We want to be stewards of our Community by adhering to environmentally sustainable business practices, production, and distribution. 

And FINALLY: We plan to become an integral part of our Community by giving back to it through charitable activities and supporting our local artists. 

Truly, Beer for the Greater Good!

description:
Crop believes in simplicity…..

We believe food is at its most flavorful, its most creative, its most passionate, when it’s at its freshest.

We believe food is at its best when it highlights the care and craftsmanship of those who bring it from the field to your plate.

We believe food is community, a series of connections between farmers and chefs and guests.

Seasonal, local flavors, hand-crafted ales and inventive libations, lovingly prepared and cheerfully served…Come and share the bounty of Crop.

name: Crux Fermentation Project
description:
Crux brewmaster Larry Sidor is always in pursuit of the next great beer—beer that defies taste profiles with its complexity and creativity. We’ve designed our brewery to allow for non-traditional brewing methods like decoction mashing, open fermentation, oak barrel aging, wild yeast strains and experimental hops.

Initially, we’ll only have a few thousand hectoliters of capacity. With added fermenters and bright beer tanks, we could push that to 11,000 hectoliters (or around 9,000 barrels). But we kinda like being small. It makes us nimble and free to experiment in ways that just aren’t possible with larger batch sizes.

Housed in a former transmission shop and mill supply store, Crux Fermentation Project was built by a community of beer lovers. To everyone who contributed ideas, materials, sweat and support, thank you. And cheers.

name: Culture Brewing Co.
description:
We can all agree, it’s a great time to be a beer lover. There are more quality beers to enjoy than ever. More new flavors and interpretations of styles. And more people dedicating their lives to the craft of brewing. Culture Brewing Co began with their own long-time passion for beer. Culture’s three owners, John Niedernhofer (Owner), Steve Ragan (Owner/Brew Master) and Dennis Williams (Owner) began brewing together long ago. From their earliest brainstorms about taking things to the next level, the goal was always to create more than just great beer. Bringing their approachable style to the already rich community of the craft beer industry, they opened their brewery in February 2013.

Our modern and rustic microbrewery is the ideal showcase for our beer. The brewery is our tasting room, with everything you need and nothing you don’t. The tasting room features an inviting beer service counter, ample indoor and outdoor space for visitors with an ocean breeze. The tasting room’s 12-tap serving system (including Nitro) allows us to deliver a large variety of our crafted beers. The on-site Brewhouse is equipped with a 10 barrel Premier Stainless System including a boil kettle, mash tun, 5 fermenters and 3 brite/serving tanks. With our beers gaining fans every day, we couldn’t be more excited about what we’ll brew next, and who we’ll get to share it with.

name: Das Boot Camp
description:
Located in Downtown Norman, Das Boot Camp is a place where people sit together and engage in conversation, meet friends and family, enjoy traditional German food and of course, some great German beer. We invite you to join us for true German hospitality as well as our great selection of German specialties created by proprietor and Certified Master Chef Andy Gmeiner. We are pleased to offer a selection of Handcrafted beers brewed by Royal Bavaria, as well as a full bar. All of our beers are brewed to German Purity Laws dating back to 1516 and are offered in mugs as well as das boot. We hope you will join us for some true German tradition and great German hospitality!

name: Dead Armadillo Brewery
description: At Dead Armadillo Craft Brewing we are committed to crafting fine beers that meet the highest standards of the industry. Our three flagship beers are an India Pale Ale (IPA), an Amber Ale, and a Wheat Beer. Our brewery was established in the Spring of 2012, the culmination of years of dreaming, drinking, hoping and planning. After all, what could be better than brewing beer for a living? It is an opportunity to spread the good cheer that comes with quality ales.

name: Dempsey's Brew Pub and Restaurant
description:
In celebration of the ballpark’s 20th Anniversary season, Delaware North Companies Sportservice, the food, beverage and retail partner of the Baltimore Orioles, has partnered with beloved former Oriole Rick Dempsey to create Dempsey's Brew Pub & Restaurant. 
The longtime catcher, a member of the Orioles Hall of Fame and 1983 World Series MVP, is also a member of the Orioles broadcast team and will make frequent appearances at Dempsey’s. 
The full-service brew pub, with a décor featuring plenty of Rick Dempsey and Orioles memorabilia, accommodates 150 in the dining area, 100 at the bar, 
and another 80 in outdoor seating on its Eutaw Street patio. We serve lunch and dinner seven days a week, year-round, featuring broad menus that are sure to hit every taste. 
And then there’s the beer! Dempsey’s features more than 20 bottled beers, including 10 local and regional craft brews, as well as four distinct draft beers brewed onsite, all featuring baseball-themed names.
Please stop in and see us for lunch, dinner or to host a special celebration.

Since then we've been rolling out our 'curiously quaffable' hand crafted brews to a growing band of merry drinkers, and loved every second of the ride. Holding true to our "Home Brewing" roots the name Dirty Bucket Brewing Co. was tossed up and the more we thought about it the more we realized there truly was no other name that better describes our passion.

description:
Dragoon Brewing Company was founded with a simple goal in mind: to increase the quantity and quality of local beer in the Arizona market. To that end, we’ll stay true to the spirit which spawned this goal — the idea that in sharing a creative endeavor with another person, you can’t help but share a bit of yourself. For DBC, that creative endeavor is craft beer, and we’re proud of the passion, integrity, and soul that we pour into every pint.

It almost goes without saying: we’re about good beer first and foremost. But there’s more to it than that. Our vision for this brewery includes the community. We aren’t setting out to compete head to head with the biggest breweries around, we’re here to produce beer that Tucson can be proud of.

name: Earth Eagle Brewings
description:
Serving "Empyreal Ales & Wonder Gruits" at our tasting room in downtown Portsmouth. The qualities some Native Americans attribute to the "Earth Eagle" (common wild turkey) speak to our philosophy as brewers and business owners: ecological, charitable, resilient, and unconventional. "Brewings" is our nod to the first brewers who made small batches for their families crafted from local grains, herbs and yeasts. At Earth Eagle Brewings we embrace a Belgian-inspired, pre-Reformation spirit where hops are but one of the hundreds of ingredients to be used in the alchemy of brewing. 
Cheers to you, intrepid imbibers, for sharing our adventures in beer.

name: Elevation Beer Company
description:
Four friends; Carlin, Christian, Sheila, and Xandy, started Elevation Beer Co. on a cool Colorado night over a few beers and a backyard BBQ.

We all had the same dream of starting a brewery that brewed the highest quality barrel aged and specialty beers we could imagine. At the same time we all dreamed of living in an area of Colorado that would allow us to sneak out of the brewhouse to catch a four-pound trout, hike a 14,000-foot peak, or slash through some of Colorado’s famous powder. In the winter of 2011 we made our dreams a reality and took the leap and started brewing in Poncha Springs, Colorado.

name: Eudora Brewing Company
description:
Eudora Brewing Co. is Dayton's first and only brew-on-premise facility and nano-brewpub. Our opening date is TBA.

At Eudora, YOU are the brewmaster. Once our doors open, you'll have the opportunity to come in and brew your very own batch of beer in our brew-on-premise facility. You'll be able to schedule a brewing appointment or simply stop by to see if a kettle is available for brewing. A variety of recipes will be available to brew, and we plan on offering more styles as we grow. Whether you've brewed before or you have no idea what you're doing, we're here to guide you through every step of the process and make it as easy and as fun as possible. 

Eudora will also serve as a taproom, where we'll brew our own ales and lagers and serve them on draft. The pub will be open to brew-on-premise customers as well as the general public. We offer a variety of award-winning house-brewed beers as well as non-alcoholic beverages and a small selection of snacks.

Eudora will also donate a portion of EVERY sale toward funding a water project for those in need of clean water. We're teaming up with a group called Charity: Water whose mission is to end the water crisis happening all over the world. With each purchase you make at Eudora, you're helping Charity: Water build wells and water purification systems in villages, schools and clinics in areas where water is difficult to obtain. We use a TON of water in the brewing process. It's the least we can do to give back and do our part to fight the water crisis. With your help, we can change lives and help make the world a better place!

In 2012, Excel Bottling Company embarked on a new bottling venture in the craft beer business serving Illinois and Missouri. Excel Bottling Company is headquartered in Breese, Ill. description: Producing small batches of high quality craft beer using the best ingredients we can find. We love hops and promise to use lots of them. We love the countryside and promise to be as environmentally friendly as possible. We also love brewing great beer for you guys to enjoy. If there's a beer you'd like us to brew, let us know.

name: Falling Down Beer Company
description:
Falling Down Beer Company (FDBC) is the newest craft brewery in the state of Michigan. Continuing the tradition of Michigan and Craft brewers before us, we will create unique hand crafted Ales and Lagers, that will challenge expectations and ideas of what great beer really is. With a focus on premium quality, handmade Ales and Lagers, FDBC will present a new unique product to the Detroit area.

Made in Michigan and the U.S.A.

One of the missions of FDBC is to create jobs and spur the economy in Michigan and the U.S. in general. At opening we plan to have 18 positions available with that number doubling year to year. Our long term goal is a bottling factory and additional restaurants that will employee hundreds of local workers.

Keeping with our philosophy of locally sourced goods and services, we will purchase from local companies whenever possible. On the food side this includes local fish markets, meat markets and bakeries; and on the brewery side designing beers that will be made using Michigan grown hops and malt. And it doesn’t stop there! We are actively negotiating and designing the brew house, promotional materials, general construction and website operations with Michigan companies.

Where it is not possible to source a product or service locally or in the State of Michigan, we will be looking first to keep our business in the Mid-West and then United States. We call this an inside-out sourcing philosophy. First source at the city level and slowly work out by county, state, region and country. We feel this benefits everyone in this endeavor where we support the community that is supporting us. A Win-Win for everyone!

It’s All About the Beer!

We are going to be creating quality; handcrafted beers that we believe will be some of the best beer you have ever tried. We are also going to push the envelope and make beers with unique and far-out ingredients that will invite you to be different and maybe live a little on the edge. We already have over 20 recipes waiting for people to try and enjoy.

name: Fifty West Brewing Company
description:
Thank you for your interest in Fifty West Brewing Company. Here is a little rundown about what Fifty West is all about:

All the beers brewed at Fifty West Brewing Company have been hand made in small batches with a focus on craftsmanship, tradition, innovation, and patience.

There are several reasons why we selected the name ‘Fifty West’; the most obvious being the fact that our brewery is located on Route 50, which extends from Coast to Coast- it spans more than 3,000 miles starting in Maryland and stretching all the way to California. 

The brewery is located in a building that has a vast and varied transient history (http://www.cincinnati.com/dining/heritage/history.html); from the settlers heading west through the Ohio River valley, to the days of Prohibition when our building was a favorite of George Remus and the bootleggers running whiskey from Cincinnati to Chicago, to where we are today—amidst a renaissance of the craft beer movement.

To us, it’s not about the destination, but instead making sure we are enjoying the journey, appreciating the moment, and brewing beers that are enjoyed by anyone who is willing to let us become a part of their journey.

We reconstruct them, but in ways you may not expect.  Our taproom displays our brewing process from laboratory to tap.  The Former Future staff is service and beer focused.  All of our friendly, down-to-Earth employees are certified by the Cicerone program and are card-carrying beer geeks.

description:
We believe that beer is a social beverage and good beer should be enjoyed with good friends. That is why we aim to bring a line of clean easy-drinking English inspired ales that everyone can enjoy to the Triangle area in late 2013. 

We love beer with extreme flavors or high alcohol content as much as the next guy, but that's not for everyone, which is why we will be producing extremely balanced and flavorful beers at a lower alcohol level that will be easily approachable and everyone will be able to find a beer that they enjoy in our lineup.

Fortnight Brewing is a true partnership of local and English flavors. The company's ownership consists of both English citizens and North Carolina natives, and our beers will utilize premium English malts and hops as well as locally-grown ingredients. 

Fortnight Brewing will be located in Cary NC with plans of opening in Summer or Fall of 2013. Keep your eyes open for a list of upcoming tasting events at your favorite area bottle shops, bars and restaurants!

With a passion for creating curiously good beers, Free Range will offer artisan brews that pair harmoniously with its farm-to-table dishes. Free Range will offer an intimate and intriguing dining space that merges with the brewery itself for a uniquely urban-farmstead feel. Beer-lovers will also be able to enjoy Free Range draughts at select area bottle-shops, bars and beer-centric establishments. The brewpub will take advantage of both the culinary and cultural resources from the region to create a product and experience that is distinctly homegrown.

name: Freedom's Edge Brewing
description:
Stop in and enjoy one of our hand crafted beers. Come out and enjoy one of our hand crafted ales and take a trip back in time.

The Tivoli Building was built in 1892 and was operated by the Richardson brothers as a saloon (and reportedly a brothel) during the period when Cheyenne was known as the "Paris of the west". 

The Tivoli has been completely restored and is ready to once again become one of the finest establishments in Cheyenne Wyoming.

name: Frey's Brewing Company
description:
Frey's Brewing Company is a small, Farmhouse Brewery in Frederick County, Maryland. Frederick County is home to several wineries and craft breweries. A small farmhouse brewery such as ours fits in the area nicely.

We received our Maryland Beer Manufacturer's Class 5 license on February 1st, 2013. We are allowed to sell beer for off-premise consumption directly to customers that have taken a tour of the brewery - but the amount is limited to 288 ounces. We are currently not allowed to do tastings at our facility, nor allow on-premise consumption of alcohol (unless it is part of a scheduled event). As of July 1st, 2013, we can refill growlers - so bring in your clean growler and we'll fill it up!

name: Full Moon Brewery
description: The Full Moon Brewery specializes in British and Irish style beers. We use Marris Otter malt as our base and then add various combinations of Black Patent, Brown malt, Crystal malt, and Roasted Barley depending on the individual beer. We use Fuggles, East Kent Golding and Challenger hops. Our brew house is a one barrel RIMS system filling one and two barrel fermenters.

name: Full Tilt Brewing
description:
In this time of exploding craft brewing around the country you really need to step up your game to stand out in the crowd. No shortcuts. No easy way outs. When we brew, we brew with the best ingredients, the best equipment, and complete devotion to making the best beer we possibly can.

We believe in the exploration and advancement of all things craft brew. We refuse to cut corners and are always looking for new ways to improve on our products. We strive to be the best and until we are we will never stop attempting to blow your minds!

name: Ghost Runners Brewery
description:
Ghost Runners Brewery is a Vancouver Washington craft brewery dedicated to the individual who enjoys premium quality Northwest beer.

Hand crafted, production only nano brewery that offers 1/2bbl, 1/4bbl, 1/6bbl beers to local and regional bars and restaurants. We also offer growler service and bottled premium ales. Beer offerings change randomly.

name: Gigantic Brewing Company
description:
Gigantic Brewing Company is an independent, crafty brewery located in the Southeast quadrant of the Peoples Republic of Portland. Brewer/Owners Ben Love and Van Havig are veterans of the Oregon brewing community.

At Gigantic we only do two things: make the best damn IPA in Portland, Oregon and produce seasonal, exciting, flavorful beers, most of which will be brewed only once. Our goal is simultaneously to create new interpretations of classic styles and to ignore those same style guidelines completely and brew whatever our creative natures produce.

name: Grapevine Craft Brewery
description:
We seek to be an inclusive community of beer drinkers. Our beer is for you, for your neighbors and for your friends. Though we are a brewery, we believe that beer is never the central figure of any moment. People are the moment makers. And great beer should be part of those moments. Our beers are crafted for good times.

North Texas is becoming well known for producing great local brews and we're excited to be a part of perpetuating that great tradition for years to come. Our beers aren't intended to slap you in the face with outlandish concoctions. But we hope that they become well crafted local classics that you'll come back to time and time again.

Clean.
Crisp.
Approachable.

It's where the good times are.

name: Grateful Hands Brewing
description: Grateful Hands Brewing produces small (20 gallon) batches of dark ales, focusing on quality not quantity. We are not a large company and have no desire to become a large company. We desire to stay small, local, and dependable. We always want to keep the creativity and fun involved in making and taking care of our beer so that it is always as enjoyable for you to drink it! We are Grateful to be able to share our beer with you. Cheers!

name: Great Raft Brewing Company
description:
Great Raft Brewing is a Shreveport, Louisiana based craft brewery dedicated to making creative, authentic beer and helping to build a great beer culture within communities it serves. Co-founders Andrew and Lindsay Nations are Shreveport natives with a passion for beer. Born from their desire to bring exciting, flavorful, fresh craft beer to their hometown, Great Raft Brewing is bringing the craft brewing tradition to Northern Louisiana. 

Great Raft Brewing was founded on the principle of brewing what we call “Real Beer.” Real Beer is brewed with creativity, passion, and authenticity. Our beer is brewed with creativity that pushes the boundaries of style, a passion for greatness, and authentic, quality ingredients. Drink Real Beer. You deserve it.

name: Great Rhythm Brewing Company
description: Great Rhythm Brewing Co. is a small craft brewing company based in Portsmouth, New Hampshire, dedicated to making flavorful, handcrafted ales, using only the freshest and most natural brewing ingredients from the earth.

name: Great Storm Brewing
description:
About Great Storm Brewing

Just like you, we love beer. We've been making beer for many years now and wanted to share our love of beer with as many people as we could. With that in mind, we founded Great Storm Brewing in 2010, and opened our doors and our taps to the public in March 2012.

Our name? Well, for us, there's a lot of anticipation in tasting a new beer. The way the foam settles in a glass of dark stout, or the raining effect you can see in a pint of IPA served on nitro... they remind us sometimes of the expectant feeling we get watching powerful storms roll in over the mountains in our home town of Colorado Springs. Yes, we tend to wax poetic over a pint glass. I told you we love beer. But anyway, that was part of the inspiration. The other part was our beloved half Husky, half Aussie brewdog, Storm. He's a little... wild. Like our beers.


We hope you'll find the same passion for drinking our beers as we do for making them. Come in and see us, we'll be pleased to pour you a pint.

And maybe wax a little poetic about it.

name: Green Wolf Brewing Co.
description: Green Wolf Brewing Company is a microbrewery located in scenic and historic Schoharie County. Our uncommon ales are crafted with love and attention to detail, using local ingredients whenever possible. Green Wolf strives to create an interconnected web of farmers, local businesses, and beer enthusiasts within New York State’s Capital Region, so that we can build a thriving market for our artisan ales. We are slated to open in May of 2014.

name: Grimm Artisanal Ales
description:
Our beers are artisanal and often Belgian-inspired. We aim to create elegant ales that are experimental and unique, balanced with complex flavors and aromas. From the recipes to the artwork on the labels, everything is designed by ourselves and our good friends.

Gypsy brewing means we are brewers without a permanent brewing home. We travel to other breweries, use their equipment to make something special, and bring the results back home to share. Think of Grimm Ales as a band, and the host brewery as a recording studio. We go into the studio from time to time and make an album (or a beer, rather!).

Each batch of beer will be a one-of-a-kind, seasonal, limited edition brew. If you like a particular beer we release, drink it up -- it may never come back around again!

Expect our first beers to pop up in New York in summer 2013. Some of our first batches might be a crisp, spicy rye abbey ale, a rich, golden Belgian tripel, and a hop-focused pale ale made with clean, slightly acidic champagne yeast.

name: Hall Brewing Company
description:
We are a traditional farmhouse brewery based in Parker, Colorado. Everything we do–from building our brewery to making the beer–we do with our own hands. We make true craft beer. We take pride in not only producing the best craft beer but also putting enough in it to suit our custom four-thousand-square-foot building we made from Colorado beetle-kill pine. That means big, ornate beer. And why not? The best isn’t always for everyone!

We are a family-owned business. Under the guidance of master brewer and construction engineer Aubrey Hall, our family has pulled together to make something special.

name: Harmony Brewing Company
description: A neighborhood brew-pub for Eastown. A comfortable place where conversation is the primary entertainment. Offering our own beers, as well as a full bar. Our menu consists of wood fired pizzas that will knock your socks off! Cheers!

name: HeadStrong Brewery
description:
Welcome to Douglas, Wyoming and the upstart of HeadStrong Brewery. Over the last couple years, we have been gradually developing a plan and product to bring to our community.  Craft Beers!  

Our promise to our customers is that we will not compromise on the quality and ingredients we put into every batch of beer we brew.

Our selection of materials will emphasize the Wyoming and Douglas experience while bringing ingredients from around the world to our customers.  Each of our craft beers will be highlighted and served in it's own special glass that will enhance the look, feel and flavor of the brewed product.

name: Heist Brewery
description: It’s going down right now. There’s a Heist happening in Charlotte. Except at this robbery everybody’s going to get their share of the loot, er…brew. After over two years of planning, Charlotte will now be called home to the Heist Brewery.

name: Hillcrest Brewing Company
description:
The Hillcrest Brewing Company (HBC), The World’s First “Out and Proud LGBT Brewery " is set to open in June of 2012 in time to celebrate the 43rd anniversary of the Stonewall Inn Uprising. We specialize in handcrafted beer and stone oven pizzas with bottles, growlers & kegs to-go. 

The restaurant, managed by Joey Arruda, serves paired pizza that is perfectly orchestrated with a focus from the water and flour to create its crust, to the fresh Italian Roma tomatoes with fresh toppings and cheeses before it is fired in stone lined ovens. 
We are located at 1458 University Avenue, in the colorful and vibrant LGBT community of Hillcrest in San Diego. HBC features four initial microbrews with plans for up to twelve more to come. Pouring only grains and grapes- our 24 beers on tap and assorted selection of wines are paired with specialty pizzas, by our talented breweristas. The remainder of the taps pours “Guest” brews from other local micro breweries. 

Our tap-room, designed in-house features an open ceiling with sealed concrete floors and a 15 foot chandelier made with 97 sustainable 22oz beer bottles that will hang within a 23 foot copula. Additional clusters of hanging beer bottle chandeliers give life to a total Frankenstein set up, with much of the equipment home-made including a steam punk style bottling machine built from scratch by David White, Brewmaster/Artist/Mad-Scientist who lives, breathes and dreams beer. A 13 foot garage door opens to an L-Shaped outdoor patio with cushioned keg barrel seating and planters with local varietal hop bines (hop vines) that can grow up to 25+ feet along horizontal trellises.

name: Hopothesis Beer Company
description: We’re relentlessly focused on making great craft beer that delivers a flavorful, approachable, balanced drinking experience for geeks and non-geeks alike.

name: Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co.
description:
Horseshoe Bend Brewing Co., is a micro-brewery located on "the Bend", of Lake of the Ozarks, a 7-mile long peninsula. It's named after its horseshoe like shape, as the lake follows it's natural shoreline. 

Chris and Carrie Case transformed a Firehouse from the 70's into a 7-barrel brewhouse.  Carrie had some roots in the Ozarks, but both moved from Colorado with a passion for craft beer. Chris worked previously as a Chef for over 20 years and Carrie with many years of Marketing and Graphic Design experience.  They figured that should be a good start for owning their own brewery.  Come to find out, Chris was really good at developing flavors and Carrie was really good at finding out what people liked...and several years of practice in the garage helped too!  

They focus on traditional brewing methods along with new techniques to produce distinct full-flavored beers!

name: Howard Brewing Company
description:
Howard Brewing Company is a brand new craft brewery opening in Lenoir, North Carolina at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

We will be opening in a great old building downtown on West Avenue alongside the Carolina Distillery and a new pub-style restaurant. We are working on some great ideas at the building including rain water recapture, solar power, and renovating the building so the dining experience literally overlooks the brewery and distillery operations. We are excited to bring our beer to you as soon as we can and are acquiring our brewhouse and swinging the hammers as you read this...

name: I & I Brewing
description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.

name: Indeed Brewing Company
description:
Indeed Brewing Company has a penchant for adventure, both in the beers we brew and the way we go about brewing them. 

We offer two flagship beers: Day Tripper Pale Ale & Midnight Ryder American Black Ale. We also brew seasonal offerings like Shenanigans Summer Ale, and Stir Crazy Winter Ale. 

Visit our taproom to to buy 10, 16, or 20-oz. beers, or take home 750 mL bottles of beer. Our tours are available on Saturday's, to sign up, visit our website at IndeedBrewing.com.

Indeed Brewing was founding in Feb. 2011, and began production in July 2012, and opened taproom in August 2012.

We distribute kegs, 12-oz. cans, and specialty beers in 750 mL bottles.

name: Infamous Brewing Company
description:
The team at IBC hails from a diverse background spanning multiple industries who have settled in ATX from other parts of Texas and from both the East and West Coasts. 
We have been home brewing for quite some time and now we are taking that passion to the next level by offering our creations to as many people as possible.
We are currently in the initial stages of development and hope to begin production by year end. Given the strict licensing process, it will probably be sometime in early 2013 before we can share our beers with the rest of Austin, but we are working hard to make that happen as soon as legally possible.
