name: Jack Pine Brewery
description:
Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery.  I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer.  A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods.  It turns out, I’m my own worst critic.  I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer.  Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer?  For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide.  It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew.  I was making some damn good beer!  I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota.  I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized.  I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles.  In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP.  I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing.  It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery.

So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan?  Start small.

Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small.  Nanobrewery small.  Brewing forty gallons at a time small.  Did I mention the brewer is small?

This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery.  It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment.  Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER!  I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing.  Now it’s your turn.  With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer.

So, stop in and give it a try!

We believe you will find that reflected in both the products we brew and in the restaurant atmosphere we create for your dining and drinking enjoyment. 
One of our goals is to be Kalona’s living room – a place where people can come to relax, relate, and have some recreation playing scrabble or dominos by the fireplace in the sofa area of the restaurant. Plus we have a fantastic beer garden to enjoy during the warmer weather.

Kalona Brewing Company and Eatery is strategically located in beautiful downtown Kalona at 405 B Avenue, a half hour drive south from Iowa City.

The brewery is home to a fifteen barrel brewing system from Newlands Systems Inc., which includes a three vessel brew house, four 15bbl fermenters, two 30bbl fermenters and two 15bbl bright tanks.

name: Kauai Island Brewery & Grill
description:
Located in downtown Port Allen, “The Worlds Westernmost Brewery” and Kauai’s only brewpub, Kauai Island Brewery & Grill is open for business and eager to serve the Island of Kauai’s craft beer drinkers!

Kauai Island Brewing Company (KIBC) has its origins in Waimea Brewing Company, which had been located on the historic Waimea Plantations. When the lease was up, owners Bret and Janice Larson, along with their brewmaster Dave Curry and his wife Christina, decided to come together and become co-owners of their newly created Kauai Island Brewing Company, moving locations to Port Allen where they would have more space to brew the delicious beers they were known for. 

After eight months of renovation, Kauai Island Brewing Company has its home in the industrial building complex of Port Allen Center, with an industrial theme to go along with both its surroundings and purpose of crafting quality beers. Its 35-foot high corrugated metal ceilings and walls give it an open and spacious feel. The retro atmosphere with chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, a catwalk leading to the second story mezzanine over the entrance, and picture perfect views of the sunset over Port Allen bay from the second story window makes it hard to say goodbye to this beautiful place.

We offer up to 10 of our own handcrafted in-house beers as well as several guest microbrewed beers, all on draft. If you can't stay for a pint, that's okay! We sell 64-ounce growlers that you can fill and take with you, as well as kegs available for customer pickup.

name: Leamside Brewery
description:

Based in Castleford Fawcett’s have been producing traditional floor malted barley for over 200 years. Traditional Maris Otter pale ale malt is the mainstay of most of our recipes.

name: Mountain Madness Brewing
description:
In 2011, the current owners answered their calling for the mountains and relocated to Durango from Phoenix, Arizona. They soon bought this restaurant with the idea of creating a true neighborhood pub in the heart of the Animas Valley where none currently exist. A new pub that focuses on a simple but tasty menu with a high energy atmosphere where everyone is welcome and comfortable. Our specialty is handcrafted gourmet brick oven pizzas complimented with great apps, salads, and sandwiches, all washed down with quality craft brews. We have a full bar, free Wi-Fi, and several HDTV's for all your sports viewing pleasure.
 
At Mountain Madness we can best be described as passionate. We're passionate about people (and dogs), we're passionate about great craft beer and gourmet pizza, and we're insanely passionate about the mountains. Mountain Madness is the culmination of a life long dream of its founder to create an experience that combines these passions.
 
We will continue to remodel, tweak, and enhance Mountain Madness as we strive to perfect your neighborhood pub. We are simple, casual, and unique by design...and we love dogs! During the summer bring your furry friends with you and enjoy our fantastic deck with the best views in town!
 
We are your apres ski destination as the closest "in-town" location to Purgatory right on Hwy. 550. We are located 2 miles north of downtown directly across from the Iron Horse Inn with plenty of free on-site parking.
 
On behalf of our entire staff, we hope to see you soon at Mountain Madness Pizza & Pub. Our people make the difference!

name: Nevin's Brewing Company
description:
Nevin's Brewing Company opened its doors in December 2012. Like all breweries, we use grain to make our beer. But unlike other breweries, we do not simply discard our used or "spent" grain. Instead, we deliver our spent grain to local farmers to use as feed for livestock and compost to enrich the soil for vegetables. We then, in turn, purchase this well-fed livestock and nutrient-rich vegetables to make our steaks, burgers, salads, side dishes and so many other items on our menu.

Our goal is not only to bring you the freshest, most flavorful food and beer possible, but also to aim as high as we can for true sustainability.

name: New Buffalo Brewing Company
description:
Buffalo, New York welcomed in the 20th century with the Pan American Exposition.  It was a time of amazing progress.  Electricity was cutting-edge technology, and the possibilities seemed endless.  Hard times lay ahead for the country and for Buffalo though; The Great War would rage and The Great Depression would last for nearly a decade before the United States would emerge from the second World War as the leader of the Free World.

What does any of that have to do with a startup craft-brewery?  The New Buffalo Brewing Co. shares the same passion for progress.  Buffalo produced over half a million barrels of brew in 1896, but by the end of the 1970's, production halted to almost zero. The United States is emerging from that low point as the world leader in brewing. Home brewing is continually growing, and new nano-breweries are popping up everywhere. Once again, The United States is leading the way by taking brewing forward into the next golden age.

So raise your glass in a toast to progress; It’s time to bring brewing back to Buffalo!

name: New England Brewing Co

name: Norderneyer Brauhaus
description:
The brew house built in Germany in the veranda of Norderneyer brewery has a rash of 500 liters. Both copper bowls are used for various multi-functional tasks and are on the cutting edge of brewing technology. In the basement are located next to the other technique, the two fermentation tanks and eight storage tanks, each with a volume of 1000 liters.
Since 500 liters are produced in the brewhouse per brewing process, there are always two consecutive brewing days for a fermentation tank can be filled with 1,000 liters. A full week has four brewing brewing days on which the two fermentation tanks are filled. On 5 Day the system is completely cleaned.

name: Omaha Brewing Company
description:
When Dr. Robert E. Lee and family decided to start a brewing company in Omaha, GA, (Yes, Georgia) it wasn't only because we enjoy a good local brew, but because craft beer isn't prevalent enough in South Georgia.

With the ideas of family, friends and quality always on our minds, we wanted to make beer that people enjoy. Not just sometimes, but every time you look at the Omaha Brewery label, taste the foam and pour a glass.

Our Brewer Nick Fowler, formerly of Atlanta's Red Brick Brewery, uses only the best ingredients (And trust us, there won't be beer unless it's fresh) and a clean, consistent method to boil and ferment a beer the general himself would enjoy.

name: Omission Beer
description:
Omission is the first craft beer brand in the United States focused exclusively on brewing great tasting craft beers with traditional beer ingredients, including malted barley, specially crafted to remove gluten.

We had a mission...to brew a great craft beer with traditional beer ingredients that everyone of legal drinking age can enjoy. Handcrafted beers made from barley, hops, water and yeast, brewed using a proprietary process to remove gluten. Well, mission accomplished. Here’s to great beer for everyone. 21 and over that is.

Brewed by Widmer Brothers Brewing in Portland, Oregon, gluten in Omission beers is removed through a proprietary brewing program and tested by two independent labs, and internally at the brewery, using the R5 Competitive ELISA gluten test. Gluten levels in every batch of Omission beer are reduced to well below the Codex standard of 20 parts per million (ppm) or less; test results for every batch of Omission beer are available at: www.omissiontests.com 

When referencing gluten, we're required by the TTB to tell you that Omission beer is fermented from grains containing gluten and crafted to remove gluten. The gluten content of this product cannot be verified, and this product may contain gluten.

Schenk's Corners, it's like a coffee shop, only with beer instead of coffee". With a staple of No. 2 Strong Ale, other usual suspects include Penguin Pale Ale (a Belgian pale ale), and The Commuter (a Kölsch-style ale), but the small brew system will allows up to 10 beers on tap at a time, constant rotation of new brews.

name: Opposition Brewing Company
description:
Opposition Brewing isn’t about doom and gloom, it’s about enjoying the time we have, while we have time left. It’s about great beer made simply. It’s about good friends, good times, and knowing that we should always live for the moment because it may all be over tomorrow.

At Opposition Brewing we love BIG beers. Be they brews with huge hop presence, big malt backbones, or prominent and unique flavor profiles, we prefer brewing and drinking beers that are approachable, but with the character necessary to challenge the mundane.

We offer a consistent selection of quality, small-batch, beers as well as rotating specialties. We brew weekly, guaranteeing some of the freshest beer on tap in the Rogue Valley. And we offer a truly unique, local, artisan experience.

We also hail from the great Pacific Northwest and choose to honor the ingredients produced here as much as possible in our brews. And while we enjoy the technology available to us now, we know that it could all go away tomorrow, so we believe in a brewing process that is distilled as far down as reasonably possible while still achieving consistently excellent results. 

So sit back, raise a pint, and let us ride this long black train together!

name: Our Mutual Friend Malt & Brew
description:
Our Mutual Friend is a brewery and taproom located in the Five Points neighborhood of Denver. For us, brewing beer began as an excuse to gather with our friends and ruminate on life, philosophy, music, food, and of course, beer. Once we got started, we grew more curious about the brewing process, honing our craft and experimenting with different methods and techniques. Along the way a fundamental question to our process was, how can we do more of this ourselves? Our desire to participate in every step of the grain to glass process led us to open Our Mutual Friend.

At OMF, our goal is to use local sources to brew local ales. This is why we malt and roast as much of the grain we use in our beer as we can. As a small maltstery, we have more influence over the quality and freshness of the beers we pour in our taproom, and more opportunities to source our ingredients locally. 100 percent of our barley is grown right here in Colorado. And as much as possible, we source our hops and specialty ingredients from farms in our state. 

Part of what we love about beer is its power to bring people together (hence our name!). We’re excited to be a gathering place in the Five Points neighborhood where locals and visitors alike can meet in camaraderie alongside a quality pint of ale. We believe in the power of neighborly acts and the spirit of neighbors taking care of one another within the local community. We at OMF support and strive for the Denver community to know each other better and enjoy a good pint in the same process. 

We are excited to see our city developing a local, world-class brewery community, and look forward to building relationships with our friends and neighbors, and collaborating with other breweries to cherish our Denver home and protect our collective local influence.

name: Outlander Brewing
description:
We are a very small-scale brewery and pub specializing in foreign and unique beers and eats.  Our brewery is a 1 barrel system (two kegs) which we use to create hand-crafted, more often than not, specialty ales.  Our brewery is based around experimentation, so our taps change frequently.  We usually do not brew the same beer twice, but will do so if enough people ask.

By definition, an outlander is a stranger, a foreigner, but here he is much more. This is how we see him: The outlander is the innovator; he is the one who drives change. It is the outlander, whether in mind or origin, who represents the ambitious, passionate pioneer who is willing to put everything on the line in order to make his dream come true. It’s often a simple dream, a dream to share his knowledge, his expertise with the ones who call him stranger. And certainly the public may reject his ideas, they may cast him back to where he came from. But does this ever worry the outlander? Never. Because the outlander believes in his ideas. He knows what he is offering is great and he knows others, once they put aside their prejudice, will know this too. He knows that someone who has invested their time, their life, their hopes and dreams behind something cannot fail. And he knows one last vital piece of information– that there have been many outlanders in this world before him and there will be many more to come.

description: Modern brewing processes collide, headlong, into ancient beer. Therein lies the Paradox. The creative forces behind Paradox Beer have explored, wholehartedly, all facets of beer, brewing and drinking and have found the Bedrock of Beer. When all else is removed, Beeris Alchemey sprinkled with Paradigm dashed on the hopes of Artistic Grandeur. In our case we took Wayward Beers, unruly at best, and Bound them in the confines of Experienced Oak in the hopes that the sum would be greater than the parts... A lofty goal! One that the human condition aspires to?

Come by on for a flight & a look around. And of course, you’ll want to take home a refillable Growler as a mouth-watering treat for the family or friends. Or you might just want to drink it all yourself!

We have loads of fun events planned, so check back here often. Bands, Food Trucks, Belly Dancing, "Body By Parkway Runners Club," Craft Nights, Cornhole Tourneys, you name it, it can happen HERE. You never know what you’ll find going on at Parkway Brewing, but fun will reign, so stop by & check us out. Only one rule: No Bad Vibes!

name: Peabody Heights Brewery
description: The Peabody Heights Brewery, located in the heart of Baltimore, MD is among the first breweries to be opened within the city limits of Baltimore in over 30 years. Its name comes from the original name of the Charles Village neighborhood in which it now sits. The brewery is the work of three entrepreneurs who hope to bring back to life Baltimore's long and storied tradition of brewing. Stephen Demzcuk, owner of the Baltimore Washington Beer Works and their popular, Raven Special Lager, has joined forces with J. Hollis B. Albert III, a local Baltimore businessman, and Patrick Beille of France, to bring this dream to life. Together, they hope to turn an old 48,000 square foot soda bottling plant into the largest production brewery in Baltimore.

name: Pedernales Brewing Company
description: Pedernales Brewing Company is proud to announce their highly anticipated opening in the city of Fredericksburg, Texas. Texas Hill Country's newest microbrewery will feature Classic and German-style beers. PBC’s impressive lineup of beers will include skillfully crafted lagers and ales. At this time we are offering our flagship brands; LOBO and LOBO Negro. “LOBO” is the name of the WOLF native to Texas and the Southwest.  Sadly, the wolf was almost wiped out by big ranchers some 100 years ago; not unlike the small craft brewers who were similarly annihilated by prohibition.

name: Pinetop Brewing Company
description:
Pinetop Brewing Company was founded in 2012 by James Maloney with the intention of creating the first Micro-Brewery in Northeastern Arizona.

PBC opened it’s doors in November of 2012 and operated a Nano 1/2 bbl system. At first, Pinetop Brewing Company was just a small tap room with limited production and hours of operation. In the Spring of 2013 James upgraded his brewing system to a 3.5BBL and significantly added to his production capabilities. Now, the brewery has 4, 4BBL brite beer serving tanks and holds regular hours of operation.

PBC’s Head Brewer is Tom Piazza out of Pine, AZ. Tom has won several state awards for his beers. Prior to joining PBC, Tom ran Mountain Top Brewery in Payson, AZ, and he distributed his beer across the state. Tom brings with him many years of brewing experience. Tom is assisted by local firefighter, Mason Manhardt, out of Show Low, AZ.

PBC brews all of it’s beers out of the Pinetop-Lakeside location at 7,000 feet elevation. In addition to our outstanding beers, we also serve BBQ food and Pizza. We hope to see you at our Tap Room or enjoying some food on our outdoor patio.

PBC : “Small Town, Big Beer”.

name: Pinthouse Pizza

The Pinthouse Pizza brewing style is a hop-forward, American-fusion style that emphasizes the flavor and aroma of the beloved hop flower without the traditional bitterness associated with hoppy beers. We are proud to be working with some of the best hop growers in the country and are excited to be showcasing these flavor profiles.

name: Rat Hole Brewing
description:
Rat Hole Brewing is a start up Nano Brewery in Central Oregon housed in a barn on 10 acres of rural ranch land southeast of Bend. A short walk from the brewery is the owners’ residence. The owners Al and Susan Toepfer, with Asst. Brewer & Marketing Guy Ken Deuser, and many more family members have spent two years taking a very run down barn that sits atop a 20,000 gallon cistern, into the great little brewery you see and taste today. 

Rat Hole will be brewing Red Ales, Porters, Browns, IPA's, Pilsners, Wheat and Specialty Beers. Some of the Specialty Beers will be seasonal brews such as Pumpkin Spice Ale, Hazelnut Brown, and Vanilla Porters as example. Other specialty beers will be a Summer Lemon Wheat, Saison, and a Blueberry Ale

Rat Hole Brewing handcrafts its beers in small batches under the close personal attention of their Head Brewer Al Toepfer & Asst. Brewer Ken Deuser. Using traditional brewing methods, Al & Ken ensure a "most excellent" taste consistently. We package our beer in bottles & draft kegs. 

Prior to becoming a commercial brewer, Al was a home brewer for many years. Ken Retired after serving 25 years in Navy traveling the world, and of course, tasting World Beers.

However, our five fermentors, with a capacity totaling 80bbl, allows us to maintain a variety of beers on tap all year long.
 
The tasting room is situated right in the middle of the brewery and allows people to experience beer and what goes into producing it. Often times patrons of the tasting room get a front row seat to the actual brewing process as our brewers are working!

name: Sanctum Brewing Company
description:
The two founding members of this amazing endeavor began as homebrewers. They ate their barley, smelled their hops and eventually grew up to be big and strong! After winning a few awards and having accolades from just about every single person who ever drank their beer (they wish), they knew it was a calling and not just a hobby. 
​
Sanctum is the natural extension of the way Jason and Scott live their lives. Their value for community, giving back to those who need it and pursuing excellence in all their endeavors is reflected in Sanctum as a company. "Why can't we use beer to help the world?" has been a common thought throughout the building process. And that's why they have decided to consistently give a portion of proceeds to charity. Every pint. Every keg. Every brew . Now every Sanctum drinker can boldly proclaim they are the most generous beer drinkers in the world!
​
Sanctum exists to be a light in the dreary world. To look mediocrity in the eye and say "no sir, I don't like it!" To push the limits of what being a craft brewery means, and to look spiffy doing it!

name: Saucony Creek Brewing Company
description:
Saucony Creek Brewing Company is a forward-thinking craft brewery proudly fashioning hyper-local beers from farm to pint in an effort to keep glass-clinking camaraderie alive and well. We’ve recognized that a truly spectacular beer possesses the power to erase all boundaries and unify individuals no matter what their differences may be.

In an industry where newbies continue to emerge and strive for originality, Saucony Creek Brewing Company is destined to break the mold with authentic, small-batch creations accented by an open-minded, “say we won’t” type of attitude. Despite our tiny town presence, there’s a world of passion and experience dripping from each Saucony sip.

It was a professional X Games and action sports career that sent a younger version of Saucony Creek Brewing Company’s current Founder and Owner, Matt Lindenmuth, hopping from country to country where artful inspiration, diverse cultures and unique individuals prevailed around every corner. He soaked it all up and particularly felt fascination for craft beer at the age of thirteen in Belgium. Fast forward through US Snowboard Team training, Guinness World Records, NBC’s Gravity Games and a collection of injuries,  it was time to leave behind one crafty career and begin another one. With some newfound free time, Matt took his long standing hobby of home brewing to the next level and began the formal process of launching Saucony Creek Brewing Company.

name: Scantic River Brewery
description: Established in 2012, The Scantic River Brewery introduced the crowd pleasing Hampden Pale Ale. This year will bring plenty of excitement to beer lovers, with the introduction of our new line of IPA's, "The Trail Ale IPA" series. With several months of testing and sample runs, we have finally finished and fine tuned the first of four IPA varieties.

name: Scars & Stripes Brewing Company
description:
The name really says it all. Four Army veterans got together one day to brew beer and talk about movies, music, video games, and life which then turned into a regular home brewing event. Not too long afterwards, it was noticed that the city of Waco, Texas didn't have a microbrewery to call its own to accommodate a growing music scene and its relaxed college atmosphere. It only seemed obvious what the next move would be.

Even though the brew-masters and owners are Army Veterans, the name Scars & Stripes stands as tribute all military veterans as a thank you for the sacrificing that has been done so everyone can live free. The mentality behind this company is not your Captain America patriotism, but rather one that embraces Independence and freedom for all with no judgement for lifestyle choices.

We will be Waco's only micro brewery! Our beer will be self distributed around various stores and restaurants in the Central and Northern Texas area but we will also have regular taste testings for anyone who is of legal drinking age to take a tour of the brewing facility and to get a free try of the craft beer we are creating. Shirts, glasses, stickers, and growlers will be available for purchase.

name: Scorpion Brewing
description:
Scorpion Brewing is a startup brewery in Calvert County Maryland.  Our beers should be ready in 2013!
 
Brian Dailey has had a passion for brewing and beer for many years and since the world will end in 2012 I figured, hey lets just start brewing and selling my craft beers to the great people of southern Maryland.

name: Scratchtown Brewing Company
description:
Scratchtown Brewing Company is a start-up craft brewery in Ord, Nebraska. We are currently constructing a new facility in downtown Ord. We expect to be operational by mid-year 2013.

Our passion is making and drinking great beer. Our mission in Central Nebraska, like Central Europe, is to craft a local beer culture that celebrates the wonderful variety of beers and build a viable industry in rural Nebraska.

In Ord, we are blessed to live among some of the most fertile land in the world, with access to some of the freshest, cleanest water on the planet - the Ogalala Aquifer. Our climate helps make our home an ideal brewers paradise, much like the old country.

We're fond of the Bohemian and Polish heritage that built Ord and the Loup Valley. We brew a wide variety of beer, but will always brew with a nod to the heritage of our home.

name: SingleSpeed Brewing Company
description:
Our mission is to brew beers built for the venturesome beer drinker, those unafraid to stray from the beaten path of simple flavors established by breweries much larger in size but not in creative energy.

As our name implies, we will be brewing at a slower rate of production than any of these monstrous breweries-designing and creating our hand crafted ales at one relatively slow pace, our "single speed", allowing each to emerge as a small artisanal batch formulated from recipes that include fresh, local, seasonal and organic ingredients.

name: Six String Brewing Co
description:
Based in Erina on the beautiful N.S.W Central Coast, situated between sydney and newcastle and proudly the Coast's first homegrown craft brewery . We are 100% locally owned company with a 100% locally made product. 

Established in 2012 and officially opening our doors in 2013, Six String Brewing Company is all about great beer and great music! The idea of opening up their own brewery was spawned in 2009 after long term home brewer Chris had had enough of the IT and corporate world took to convincing old school friend, Adam that it was more than just a great idea. After a number of 'research trips' to Western Australia, New Zealand and the U.S it was a good 12 months before the idea got off the ground and the reality of what was involved began to hit home. After a number of false starts and a marathon of bureaucratic hurdles  the current location was secured in 2012 and the real fun of setting up the brew house and taproom began. 

Six String Brewing company has in the short time its been open has with chris' brews and Adams sales expertise gone from strength to strength and hope to continue spreading word of the craft beer revolution happening across Australia starting with the Central Coast.

description: Societe Brewing Company is a production brewery founded in San Diego, California by fellow professional brewers Travis Smith and Douglas Constantiner.  In 2012, Societe Brewing Company began production and opened its doors to a warm welcome from the San Diego craft beer community.  The brewery and tasting room occupy a 16,000 square foot facility in Kerney Mesa, in the eastern part of San Diego.  Societe Brewing Company focuses on hoppy Out West ales, Belgian-inspired Old World ales, and dark and flavorful Stygian ales.  The brewery also features a 3,000 square foot barrel room, and there are intentions to release a line-up of barrel-aged sour beers in the future.  Societe’s beers are available locally throughout San Diego, and also available at the tasting room.

name: Stony Creek Beer
description: Here at Stony Creek Brewery, we think there's nothing better than drinking a true craft beer. Craft beer is an adventure and a destination. It tells the story of our local flavor. You see, it's not just a beer to have, it's a beer we’ll have with you.

name: Storm Peak Brewing Company
description:
Consider our taproom your new living room. Watch a live show on one of our music nights or catch a game on one of our big-screens. Order some food from our list of delivery companies or share a bowl of popcorn from our snack collection. Make yourself at home. 

Our beers explore a wide range of styles and dimensions from our light, crisp, Golden Ale to our dark and intriguing Black Ale. Aside from our staple brews, we offer a range of seasonal styles that explore the beautiful and ever changing seasons of the Yampa Valley. Have a style you’re really craving? Let us know and we just might make it!

name: Strong Arm Brewing
description:
We love beer! We have a passion for brewing it, sharing it with our friends and of course drinking it. We wanted to do something we love, a dream turned into reality and strong arm brewing was born. 

We have spent the last few years perfecting our brews and now you can enjoy the fruits of our labor with us. When you are as committed as we are to the process, use the best ingredients and understand beer like we do the end result is nothing short of wonderful. 

So join us by gathering a few friends and tilting back a chilled pint glass filled with one of our signature brews. We thank you for doing so and know you will love it as much as we do.

name: Stumblefoot Brewing Co.
description:
Stumblefoot Brewing Co. has set out to make some of the most interesting styles of beer we can think of. We want our beer to be an artisan experience of local flavor. 

Stumblefoot Brewery is in its second year of joining the ranks of new breweries. We have setup in San Diego's North County - in San Marcos, CA. This area has become known as a mecca for beer. And all you need to do be a part of it is ... Represent!

Stumblefoot is a name that personifies the boot strap and prototyping format we have gone about creating our brewery. The name pays tribute to our willingness to experiment.

We decided to come up with a definition that incorporates the essence of our experience:
Stumblefoot – \’stəm • bəl • fut\ (noun) 
1) The art and science of gaining new knowledge through the happenstance of interesting encounters. Fortune favors the prepared.
See also: Organic, sharing, open-minded, kismet, lucky

We love our beer. In a region that has taken microbrews to a whole new level, we pride ourselves on brewing awesome craft beer that includes the lighter side of brewing as well as the killer hoppy fare.

We’re just as proud of our outrageous service. Great beer needs to be shared. We’re positioned to do just that here in Sunriver and beyond. Whether we’re serving customers in our brewpub or working with our distributors and their outlets, our awesome beers are brewed to be relished. You’ll crave our high-quality, easy-drinking beer and we’ll do whatever it takes to share the love.

Featuring small, handcrafted batches of beers. Specializing in beers that apeal to non-beer drinkers, beer drinkers, and foody types.

Our promise to you is to not make boring beer! We are located within the Amocat Cafe in downtown Tacoma.

name: Tap Brewing Company
description:
Formerly 2 separate entities (The Haverhill Brewery & the Tap Brewpub) we have decided it's in everyone's best interest to consolidate into one, singular brand. That is why as of October 1, 2012 we became The Tap Brewing Company!

The Tap Brewing Company is located inside a nearly 120 year old mill that at one point was the epicenter of Haverhill's massive shoe manufacturing industry. High ceilings, dark grain wood, exposed brick and rich character. We highlight the history of the building without it becoming an intrusive element. Our style is simplistic and straight forward, both in atmosphere and menu. We're right in the middle of a bustling downtown that sits along a beautiful river which our large deck overlooks for an incredible outdoor dining experience in the Summer months. Or heck, a pint during a snowstorm. Our hope is to provide you with a great meal, great beer and outstanding service in a laid-back atmosphere. A mellow, all-encompassing brewpub experience.

name: Ten Ninety Brewing Co.
description:
Our mission is to brew unique and flavorful beers that break through traditional style guidelines and enhance the beer-drinking experience. Come along with us as we explore new flavors and create new styles that will have us all celebrating the good days.

Craft beer transforms four simple ingredients into something great. At Ten Ninety, we further this transformation to produce refreshing yet complex and challenging beers from unique ingredients and processes. As we reach beyond traditional combinations of water, malted grain, hops, and yeast, we are unapologetically proud to say that we brew extraordinary small batch beers meant to be thoughtfully enjoyed. Simply put, Ten Ninety is craft beer elevated.

name: THAT Brewery & Pub
description:
THAT Brewery, just off the Arizona Trail in Pine, AZ is a place for people who like beer! We like beer – like to drink it, brew it, tip it and sing songs about it. Opened June 2012. THAT Brewery craft brews are available in many of your local pubs. Come up to Pine to see it all in action - great craft brews (THAT Brewery concoctions and other locally brewed guest craft beers), food, wine, volleyball, horseshoes and good times in the great Northern Arizona cool air. It’s a beautiful drive along the Mogollon Rim with an awesome destination - great craft beer from the source! By the way, we're good people too - actively a part of many charity groups in the area including: Friends of Tonto Natural Bridge, Mountain Village Foundation, Pine Strawberry Business Community, Pine Strawberry Fuels Reduction, AZ Trails Association, RiffRaff Club and the Justice McNeeley Foundation (childrens medical needs charity). We reach out and do all that we can in order to help these and many more groups in the area with fundraising, donations, organizing events and are always happy to give our time!
Cheers!

The result is smooth, delicious pale, red, stout and medieval gruit ales - or any beer you care to custom order. Each bottle is filled by hand and conditioned at optimum temperatures. name: The Brewer's Cabinet
description:
Our small batch brewery allows us the flexibility not to be limited by popular fads, current trends or industry pressure in crafting our beers.

Our Brew Masters have been fully empowered so that there are no limits on creativity or style. We only ask that they do what they do best and brew with passion and love. We will also be featuring an impressive selection of guest draft handles and bottle selection to help compliment our own beers.

With a small kitchen onsite, we will be creating a fresh and local menu for our customers with an emphasis on quality ingredients that pair superbly with our brews. We want to create a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere for our customers, so that they can enjoy the environment no matter what time of the day, nor what the occasion is.

The Brewer’s Cabinet will focus on spreading awareness of the local brewing community. We hope to feature local commercial breweries and their great beers, which we hope will lead to a series of collaborative projects in creating new beers. We want a strong local home brewing community, that is part of the brewery, with the invitation to come in and help design beers with our brew masters. We truly want to be a “Brewer’s Cabinet” for the Reno area!

name: The Fat Cat Beer Company
description:
We ain't serious about a lotta things, but beer ain't one of 'em!™ Available in GA, AL, VA, FL and CA, The Fat Cat™ Beer Company, LLC is dedicated to providing a palate worthy handcrafted beer experience. Iconic packaging, award worthy beer, competitive pricing and an all round good attitude makes us Fat Cat™ indeed.

We believe in maintaining the smallest carbon footprint possible which is why we contract brew our own recipes (a/k/a Statements of Process for all you beer geeks) and why most if not all of our beer is packaged in a can. Our Fat Cat™ Lager was the FIRST handcrafted beer in a can when it made its debut in 1995!

name: The Filling Station Microbrewery
description: The Filling Station Microbrewery is located in the historical railroad depot with beautiful views of the Boardman Lake and directly on the T.A.R.T. bike trail. Our flatbreads and microbrews use the freshest ingredients available. David Cannizzaro, head brewer, uses a 10bbl & 3bbl brewing system which allows him the freedom to create small batches of craft brews in a variety of styles.

name: The Front Brewing Co.
description: Born in the majesty of the Rocky Mountain Front, which also lends us our name, The Front Brewing Company is one on Montana's newest breweries. Located a stone's throw from the beautiful Missouri in the West Bank One development in Great Falls, we began brewing in the summer of 2012. Using Montana's finest barley coupled with only the highest quality speciality malts, hops, yeast, and good clean water we use only the best ingredients in our beer. Our beer's which are unique versions of classic and modern beer styles pay homage to the great brewers of yesterday and today, while inspiring the future. We believe in beer made RIGHT here to be enjoyed anywhere. Cheers

name: The Granary 'Cue & Brew
description:
We strive to make fresh, handcrafted, honest beers that can be enjoyed by all.  All of our beer is made within the four walls of our restaurant, which means that when it hits your glass it is the freshest beer you can get.   Our beers are never filtered or pasteurized and are always full of character and flavor.  We brew styles from American and Belgian to anything in between.  We typically brew our beers with four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and San Antonio water.   However we have been known to add things like coffee, fruit, spices, and anything else that might catch our fancy.

At The Granary we love beer as beer helps to enrich our lives.  We take our beer and food seriously and we hope to politely challenge people’s perspective of how beer can be paired with food.  We believe that every meal that is served can be made better when paired with the right style of beer.  This is not your grandma’s beer.

Quality over quantity is always the motto as they focus on producing unique beers that remain highly drinkable. No corners are cut with the use of high quality ingredients and traditional brewing methods.

name: Thorn Street Brewery
description: At Thorn Street Brewery, we are committed to bringing the neighborhood brewery back to reality and making you that better beer. We can think of no better neighborhood than North Park to begin this project. It’s a neighborhood where folks pride themselves on walking or riding their bike to get locally produced food, where people devote large parts of their property to growing their own edibles, where people love gardening, fishing, and of course brewing their own beers. No where that I have seen in a major city is there such a community where the residents seem so bound together by a common philosophy. Reduce your carbon footprint, eat local, buy local, produce something local, be self sufficient as much as you can, smile, and please try to leave the world a little better than you found it, because, after all, we are just renting it.

Three Brothers Brewing is a craft-brewery that is currently distributing local beer to western Virginia! Look for our tasting room to open in early 2013.

At Three Brothers Brewing,our mission is to brew and sell the best craft beer possible. As a family owned business, we focus on both the community that we live in and the community that we have created.
We're proud of our commitment to tap into local products and services to bring you what you are looking for... a truly unique, quality craft beer for our retailers and consumers.

locations.hoursOfOperation: Call

name: Three Notch'd Brewing Company
description:
On June 3, 1781, in the heart of the Revolutionary War, Jack Jouette made his legendary horseback ride to Charlottesville to warn Governor Thomas Jefferson and his legislators of an attempt at their capture by an advancing British Calvary.
Led only by moonlight, Jack rode 40 miles along a backwoods trail marked by three distinct axe notches in the trees, a path later known as Three Notch'd Road.
We here at Three Notch'd Brewing Co. will never be as legendary as some of the most revered characters in Virginia history, but we do aim to leave our humble mark in the world of craft beer.

Jack left his mark, we're leaving ours, how will you leave yours?

Three Notch'd Brewing Company, LEAVE YOUR MARK.

name: Tin Man Brewing Company
description: Tin Man Brewing Co. was assembled in 2012, an alloy of production brewery and restaurant. Committed to sustaining a habitable environment for all living and mechanical being, we utilize innovative processes to minimize waste and maximize taste. Forging new ground, we were one of the first small craft breweries in the United States to use a mash filter.

name: Twelve Rounds Brewing Company
description:
Our passion for great brews and great food both began in the kitchen. Dan started brewing around 1990, using extracts. He took up the hobby in earnest which meant taking over the garage 5 years ago and transitioning to all-grain brewing. Both Dan and Elle love to cook and brewing days became a natural outlet for hosting all days BBQs with family and friends. The 5-gallon kettle over the kitchen stove grew to a half-barrel, propane-fueled brew rig. And the backyard gained a pellet-smoker alongside the Weber grill. That’s what we call going the distance with brewing and charcuterie!

With family and friends raving about our creation, it’s time to take it seriously. We entered the 2011 California State Fair and won three medals including first place for our Knock-Out Stout and second place for The Contender – our Pale Ale. The following year we won first place for our Scottish Ale which we plan on featuring as one of our seasonal brews.

In early 2012 we decided to pursue opening our own microbrewery. Our first challenge seemed almost insurmountable: finding a name! We hit trademark snags with our first three names and finally scored with Twelve Rounds.

name: Two-Shy Brewing

name: Union Brewing Company
description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

name: Water Street Brewing Co.
description:
We love brewing. We offer high quality craft beer, brewed on premises and
served directly from our tanks. Our patrons feel like they’re in the middle of a brewery...because they are. On brew day and during fermentation you will experience all the wonderful sites, smells and sounds of the brewing process.

You will find familiar and not-so-familiar styles on tap. We like to keep things interesting—there’s always something new. While somewhat conservative in the big tanks you never know what we'll put on tap for small batches. Toasted coconut stout anyone?

name: Wayward Brewing
description:
The Wayward Brewing Company is a new craft brewery that is currently being established in the once grungy, but now trendy, inner-west part of Sydney Australia.

Our philosophy is all about brewing great beers that don't always fit with traditional styles. Someone once said that Wayward meant "being lost, but on purpose".

We might not have our own brewery space (yet), but all of our beers are created by us and we take 100% responsibility for the product that ends up in your glass.

We happily admit that we are beer geeks, but we’re definitely not trying to prove we are more clever than the next brewer by designing the wackiest beer that only our fellow beer geeks will appreciate. We believe there is a fine line between different and undrinkable and are happy being on the more drinkable side of that line. We can't promise that we will never stray into more odd concoctions, but we'll warn you if we do.

As well as being beer nuts, we're food nuts too. Wayward beers are great on their own or we think even better served with food.

name: White River Brewing
description:
As a small batch brewery, White River Brewing Company specializes in traditional European beers, particularly styles from Belgium, Britain, and Germany, all with an American twist. With uncompromising quality, at White River Brewing Company we work hard to make each flavorful, complex sip, a special occasion. With every batch we use only the finest ingredients available, individually chosen to add layers and complexity to each of our products.
 
Quality Craft BeerDesigned to appeal to the weekend warrior and discerning enthusiast in all of us, our four staple offerings and seasonal rotating beers are adding steam to the craft beer revolution in Southwest Missouri, and delivering a unique experience in every bottle.

name: White Street Brewing Company
description:
White Street Brewing Co., proud to be located in historic downtown Wake Forest, is a small, locally owned independent manufacturer of craft beer. You can enjoy White Street's flavorful handcrafted ales and lagers in restaurants and bars throughout the Triangle and beyond. Or sit down in our taproom where you can see the entire brewing operation and let us pour you some brewed-on-the-premises goodness.

While snacks are available in our taproom, we are not a restaurant. Our focus is brewing beer and we're not only passionate about it, but we're darn good at it, too. From tours and t-shirts to dart leagues and other special events, you will discover Something's Brewing on White Street.

We also have an exciting menu of appetizers, pizzas and sandwiches, all baked in our wood-fired pizza oven. So, stop in for lunch with your co-workers, bring the family for dinner, or meet your friends for a few brews after work. We're waiting for you!

name: Wicked Weed Brewing Company
description:
In 2009 Walt and Luke sat at a craft beer bar and talked about the dream of opening their own brewery that would focus on big West Coast hoppy ales and authentic Belgain ales that would inspire those who drank them. From that conversation forward there would be no looking back. A business plan was developed and hundreds of test batches brewed. In 2011 Walt and Luke’s lifelong friend Ryan Guthy and his parents Rick and Denise all sat down at their house in the mountains of Western North Carolina to taste some of Luke and Walt’s creations while looking over the plans for what would be Wicked Weed Brewing.  After being thoroughly impressed with the full flavor and vision of the project, the Guthys joined the Dickinsons and the team was assembled.  Over the next months Wicked Weed Brewing found a home at 91 Biltmore avenue, a building that seemed destined to be a brewery.
With the creativity of Luke, vision of Walt, dedication of Ryan, exquisite taste of Denise and wisdom of Rick a truly unique brewery was born.  So from the humble beginning of a basement, the dream of Wicked Weed Brewing has come to life. Our beer is bold, full of excitement and flavor.  Always focused on drinkability and pushing the boundaries of what we think we are capable of.  Wicked Weed Brewing will always evolve, always grow and always aspire to be greater.  Join us in bringing something a little Wicked to Asheville.

name: Wiens Brewing Company
description: Wiens Brewing Company is a new Temecula brewery! We were happy to open our doors on November 10th, 2012. You may ask if we are affiliated with the winery in Temecula, Wiens Family Cellars, and the answer is yes. The Wiens family has come together yet again in the community of Temecula to open another fun destination. Along with making wine, the Wiens family has been brewing beer for nearly 17 years. At Wiens Brewing Company you can enjoy tastings of beer, pints, or even have a half-gallon-growler filled to enjoy at home. This Temecula brewery tasting room is very spacious with open areas to see the brewhouse and all of our shiny tanks. Come down and try some of our latest beers while we are open Monday through Thursday from 3pm to 8pm, Friday from 1pm to 8pm, or join us on the weekends from noon to 8pm. Spend a day in Temecula and enjoy Temecula's newest brewery, Wiens Brewing Company.

name: Wildcard Brewing Company
description:
Wildcard Brewing Company was just a dream until experience, encouragement and circumstance made it a reality. The idea behind the name Wildcard is to pursue the unknown. Wildcard Brewing Company’s owners left stability for chaos, moved to England to learn the craft of beer making, and started a business in an uncertain economy, all in pursuit of a dream. You’d call them crazy, adventurous, unpredictable....a wildcard. Our story is one of the unexpected; a place where there are no limits, where perseverance and a free spirit will turn dreams into reality. 

It started when Jeff and Jenny brewed two beers to give away as wedding favors at a brewery in San Luis Obispo where they went to college. Homebrew projects and burst bottle explosions ensued in the years after. But a casual passion soon turned career as Jeff and Jenny headed to England. Jeff studied brewing science at the University of Sunderland and Jenny conducted “research” in various local pubs. Once back in the states Jeff headed straight for the most competitive brewing location, the Pacific Northwest. Now 4 years later the pair are back in Jeff’s hometown of Redding building out their production brewery.

Wildcard is small startup business focused on brewing flavorful beers and enriching the communities that enjoy them. Spending dollars locally is just a part of that commitment. We will source products and services within 500 miles of our facility as much as possible and intend to exclusively sell beers within that same area. Supporting local businesses not only has great economic impacts but environmental as well. We don’t want to just do business in the Redding community we want to be a part of it. It is important to give back as much as possible to the community and we will make it a point to donate and get involved in local causes and efforts.
